Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Roger C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great!! Comes with a complimentary breakfast buffet. Right in the middle of San Marcos Venice. Easy to get via public vaporettos. Staff very helpful. The style is very contemporary European. They have robes,slippers,and delivered complimentary bottle of champaign to the room. I will always stay here if I travel to Venice. Very reasonable price for a 5 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: loves_to_travel88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located right in the heart of the San Marco district 3 minutes walk to St Mark's Square and 7 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. Unfortunately the tide was high meaning out water taxi had to drop us off on the Grand Canal the nearest point to the hotel as it couldn't negotiate the bridges for a doorstop delivery! We had a good map and it didn't take too long to find our way. The hotel itself was clean and welcoming with a lovely dining room for breakfast in the tented annex. Breakfast was a buffet style with cereals, yoghurts, fruit, meats, cheeses, scrambles eggs and bacon and pastries. Dinner looked expensive even with the 15% discount we were given so we ate elsewhere. The room was small but adequate and had a view over the canal at the back which could be noisy first thing in the morning when the rubbish barge came by and delivery boats too. Make sure you keep the windows closed towards dusk as we did have a problem with a mosquito one night! The turning down of the beds in the evening was a nice touch. We booked two trips with viator before we left the UK, a boat tour of the Grand Canal which was very informative and a half day excursion to Murano, Burano and Torcello. This trip could have been wonderful if only we had had more than 35 minutes in each place. Burano was beautiful and I would have liked to have spent longer there. The guide gave a commentary across the Venice lagoon in about 5 different languages so it was all a bit rushed and I didn't feel I learnt much. My advice would be to take the water bus (vaporetto) and take your time. Murano was full of glass blowing factories that just wanted to sell you their glass products - give it a miss unless you really want to buy something. Everything they sell can be bought in one of the hundreds of gift shops in Venice. Best way to see Venice? Go and get lost! St Mark's Square and Rialto is almost always signposted to you can always find your way back. I would definitely return to Venice and stay in this hotel but will bring extra money for a gondola ride which could set you back 80-100 euros.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: Good location and rooms but without free wifi, at a charge of 20 euro per day this should be included in the room rate, particularly as you can pick it up free in the lobby! :-) Breakfast is good, but no tea and coffee or water in the room but they do give free toothbrushes, and lots of toiletries, would prefer tea and coffee. Very modern, clean and contemporary with lovely smelling lilies all around the hotel. Directions from Rialto bridge could be better as we stumbled across it

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gcaug2006
Reviews.Content: Overall, a nice experience. The rooms were clean and well sized. The staff was helpful. The hotel loses a point because of inadequate and expensive Wi-Fi. Best bet is to sit on the red couch in the lobby and pick off the Wi-Fi from a nearby restaurant. We did experience some shortages at breakfast, but it was during a holiday peak. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Seachange91362
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, with friendly and helpful staff. I had a huge, beautiful, immaculately clean and comfortable room. A very large, luxurious bathroom with high-end toiletries, robe and slippers. A large walk-in closet filled with drawers, shelves and hanging space and a rack for my suitcase. I was traveling with a video camera, SLR, laptop and phone, and there were enough power outlets for me to charge everything simultaneously without having to move any furniture or unplug the lamps or TV. The wifi worked flawlessly, and I was able to Skype home every night. I stayed for a week, so all the comfort and convenience was well appreciated. It felt very luxurious to me at the end of some long, long, working days. I had always envisioned staying in a beautiful old palazzo on my first trip to Venice, but this place was so nice, comfortable, modern and well-located that I was glad I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff were pleasant and helpful. Perfect location - 5 minutes walk away from the Ponte di Rialto and Piazza San Marco. Room was spacious, modern and very comfortable. Very comfortable king bed. The breakfast is served in the Hotel Bonvecchiati and wasn't up to the standard I expected.Food at restaurant was good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: Ali F
Reviews.Content: After having trouble finding this hotel we arrived at the reception desk where we were given our key and shown our room. The reception staff and man who took us to our room were unfriendly and sterile. The room was as shown in their photos, nothing special, and smaller than we thought. We even upgraded to a junior suite before we arrived, but to be honest this suite is actually a standard room with a bench type seat. Wifi was 6 euros an hour, or 20 euros a day. We felt very let down by this hotel and its unfriendly staff, and decided to cancel the next two nights. We were having a drink in the compo st Maria when we saw the Ruzzini hotel. We went in and asked if they had any rooms available for the nxt two nights, and not only did they advise us on the room selections, they showed us rooms available. We moved out of the Bonvecchiati. When I approached the reception desk to change hotels, I gave room 106 instead of 160 by mistake, and the man informed me quite sternly, that there was no room 106 and proceeded to serve another couple. (this couple had a baby in a pram, and i overheard him say they could have a cot put in their room for 35 euros a night!! They declined.) So I waited till he had finished with that couple and again approached him with the correct room number. We would not recommend or go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “UNFRIENDLY staff, USELESS directions, SMALL bathroom &room, CHEAP room furniture, THIN walls”
Reviews.Author: cuteasianjock
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at various hotels in Italy (Rome, Florence, Milan, Turin and now Venice) from 3 stars to 5 stars on multiple trips (and I've been to Paris many, many times and stayed at 3 to 4 star hotels) and I was really disappointed at Palace Bonvecchiati where I stayed for two nights recently. First of all, the directions they e-mailed me were USELESS! They just told me to get off at the Rialto waterbus stop! That was it!!! I thought the hotel would be really close to the stop or there would be signs. But no! And I had to ask a nice shopkeeper for directions! The front desk staff member in the afternoon when I checked in was professional but not personal. On the contrary, I saw with my own eyes how this same staff LAUGHED and BANTERED with other guests who happened to be Caucasians. I'm nice and friendly with sense of humor so too bad I didn't get to use it! The porter who took my luggage to the room had a resentful look on his face even after I tipped him! I booked a deluxe double room which I didn't find spacious or special. I requested an upgrade which I totally understand depends on availability and they put me on a high floor. But the room was not satisfactory. Yes, there's a small foyer with closet and hallway but those are WASTED spaces. The ACTUAL ROOM where the bed is is not very big. Same goes for the bathroom. And there is NO SPACE for the toiletry at all in the bathroom! The photos they show online have a double sink but there's only one small sink in my room. The white desk and chair in the room looked cheap. Nothing special about them. The hotel room walls are THIN! I could hear people talking in other rooms from the hallway and from my room! The doors bang loudly when people close them. The night staff (tall and shaved head guy) was not friendly at all. He NEVER CRACKED A SMILE. In fact, he had an ATTITUDE problem. I had to use my iPhone (which by the way you have to PAY EXTRA for wi-fi!) in the lobby because the connection in my room was lousy. And I will NEVER FORGET THE DISDAIN and DIRTY LOOK that he shot me as he walked past me (sitting in a corner chair) to go to his staff room next to me. Like my SILENT presence there interfered with his chatting with the porter! So glad I only stayed there for two nights! I should've stayed at ACQUA Palace (which I also wanted to try but chose Bonvecchiati instead. Big mistake!) instead for those two nights! I was in Venice for four nights and for the other two nights, I stayed at Pesaro Palace ON THE GRAND CANAL which I personally much prefer! The front desk staff members at Pesaro were all friendly and lovely and personal. Their location is RIGHT next to a waterbus stop! And their lovely courtyard ON THE GRAND CANAL is amazing! There are also 3-4 delicious and moderately priced (by Venice standards lol) restaurants very close to Pesaro. On the contrary, the restaurants near Bonvecchiati are VERY touristy and expensive and some not very good. I'm not the only one who's complained of their poor customer service and unfriendly staff. Check the other reviews including booking and you'll see others! I e-mailed Palace Bonvecchiati over 10 days ago saying the room was not satisfactory and the staff not friendly. And I waited for their response all this time. Nothing! They did not even acknowledge my e-mail! It speaks VOLUME about their customer service! Seems like once you've stayed there and they've taken your money, they don't care about your opinions and whether you had an enjoyable stay or NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Good situation”
Reviews.Author: Quentin R
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my wife during 4 days in January 2012. It was such a good place to stay for those 4 days. The hotel is just between Rialto Pont and Saint Marc Place. It is only 3 minutes to go to those places. The entery of the hotel is so luxury and rooms are well organized and nice. There are some details which are bad as painting on room wall, floor are sometimes a little dirty but the room is clean and beds are so comfortable. Bathroom is clean an nice with bathtub and shower. People working in the hotel are very nice and they give good explanations to visit Venise. But you will discover when you arrive at the hotel that you have to pay 8â‚¬ per day and per person by cash at the end of your journey. You can enjoy the spa and and training space which are clean and nice. If you go to the hotel during a low season you can ask a standard room with nice view and bathtub and you may have a Deluxe Room for the same price. It is what happened to us. The breakfast is not extraordinary but the price is included with the room so it is good. But remember that if you have a view on water, you will hear noise from boats which works at 5 or 6 in the morning so close your window. Moreover, it is nice to be at the second or third floor because you will have a better view on the sky. Enjoy venise...

Reviews.Title: “efficient luxury”
Reviews.Author: Victorians63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a new year's break in December 2011. good sized rooms for a crowded city centre hotel, spotlessly clean, everything worked and staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Excellent breakfast buffet and the sister hotel provided a quality meal for the new year's Eve celebrations. Pricey, but fair value for this level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: MartinsRJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palace Bon Vecchiati last December,2011, before boarding the Star Princess in its Trans Atlantic cruise, from Venice to Rio. It's not the same hotel we've been in, last year, and we were very satisfied with this change. The Palace Bon Vecchiati was a wonderful choice, in many ways. First of all, it has been totally refurbished. Rooms are... roomy, with modern furniture and clean decoration. We got a mini-suite, with a view to the rear "street", which allowed us to see many gondolas passing by, many of them with singing gondolieri. If you come from Marco Polo airport by watertaxi, the hotel features a private dock, which is very convenient. But, if you prefer to come by Vaporetto, there's another nice feature: the hotel location. Palace Bonvecchiati is located at Calle dei Fabri, which runs from Rialto neighborhood to St. Mark's square. Rialto bridge is one of the famous Venice attractions, and is also one of the Vaporetto's stops. From there to the hotel it's a short, almost-straight walk, without any bridge to cross. St. Mark's Basilica, at St. Mark's square, is Venice main attraction. The hotel sits half way, from Rialto to St. Mark's square. Shopping is at hand, and so is Hard Rock Cafe. Hotel staff is very handy and nice. They provided us with all sort of information we needed, from store locations to Vaporetto schedule. The daily rate includes breakfast, with breads, cheese, cold cuts, jelly, eggs, cereal, fruits, juice and cakes. It's a small buffet, but we could allways find good choices for the meal. Everything is fresh and tasty. Buffet staff is also very nice. The hotel doesn't feature a restaurant, but we didn't feel the need, for there's plenty of good options in Venice, from pizza to five-course meals. We surely recommend Palace Bonvecchiati and we would come back. One final word: there's another hotel, very close to this, called Bonvecchiati (without PALACE). This review covers only Hotel Palace Bonvecchiati. We know nothing about the other one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: anapin
Reviews.Content: From December, 4th, before going on a cruise, we spent 4 nights at this excellent hotel. It's a four star hotel, well located, totally refurbished with contemporary furniture. If you like clean and modern decoration it's the place to go. The staff is very attentive, handy and gave us excellent suggestions for dining. The most important (we already knew) was the "Bistrot de Venise", almost facing the hotel. Breakfast was fair, with juices, cereals, scrambled eggs (no more choice of eggs), cold cuts and breads. Location was unbeatable. Just five minutes walking to San Marco square and all stores - from Prada, Gucci, Versace etc to street vendorsâ€¦ We've got an executive room, facing the Canal. I'll, for sure, return to this hotel, next time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION & GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: Those reviewers who say the Bonvecchiati is 10 minutes from Rialto and 8 minutes from St- Mark's square must be blindfolded and wal on their knees. It is honestly 5 minutes to previous, and litterally 3 minutes from the latter. And no rush at that. My fourth time in the Doge's city, but my parner's first. We wanted to make it the lavish way, but there is no way I am ever going to shell out 1.300â‚¬ in an old palace with a view, last refurbished in the 1950s to offer a decadent and derelict vision of 18th century Venice. Never. Ever. Well apparently they got the point : the Gritti just shut down for a 2-year renovation, hopefully going beyond new drape fixtures. However, besides the handiest possible location, Bonvecchiati did things well. It is not overly glamourous, but for 371â‚¬ per night inclusive of tax and breakfast, we got ourselves in their best accommodation : Deluxe Junior Suite, offering 40 sq.m of space, 3 windows in the bedroom, one of which with a view of St-Mark's Tower (when the fog eventually cleared for minutes), one large bathroom with a window, and a small dressing room, made in dazzling tones of turquoise blue. We were perfectly with that. Good bed, although on the harder side. As often happens in Europe, an alleged King actually made up of two queens stuck together. Faultlessly : the groove was hardly noticeable. Numerous bathroom amenities beyond the basic gels make up for a more luxurious touch than actually is. Breakfast is decent. Not overwhelming selection, but enough for a few days. Although the dining room is small and busy, the staff work hard to keep it fresh for the next guests, and I never noticed any waiting line. The Bonvechiati Palace has its own dock : convenient if you splurge on the motoscafo (private taxi boat) ride (120â‚¬), as they will deliver/pick you and your luggage right inside the hotel. Only let the driver know you go to the Palace, and not another Bonvecchiati property. This will make you happy, looking in the streets at those poor folks dragging their luggage, even on wheels, from God knows where up and down flights of stairs. 120â‚¬ wisely spent, we thought. Venice is possibly the vastest tourist trap in the world. Go to St-Mark's Square for 5 minutes, and take a street away from it, any street, turn a corner, any corner, and you'll be by yourself. The crowd will be gone. Walk a little bit farther, and sink into the Venetians' Venice. This is where the charisma of this town is. Speaking of tourist trap, there seems to be a canyon between 2 kinds of food outlets. Overwhelming numbers of restaurants targeting budget tourists, with similar menus similarly and cheaply priced (can you go wrong with italian food, really ?). Very few high end (at least not after the style, but certainly after the price) trattorias offering Venetian cuisine to a mixed crowd of locals and puzzled tourist. I had never seen, anywhere in the world, even remote muslim countries, restaurants applying a 5 to 7 factor to a bottle maimstream French Champagne ; I guess there is a first time for everything. Well, at Trattoria Do Forni, and Trattoria Da Ivo, a 2-course meal for 2, with 2 glasses of Prosecco, 1/2 bottle of cheap (???) wine set us back 240â‚¬. Wow. Food was pretty good but not even remotely great, and a fair price should have been 50% cheaper. So be prepared ... And enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Staff, Wonderful Rooms, Absolutely Perfect .”
Reviews.Author: scattycat69
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a last minute basis and were very pleased with the reduction we receieved for the weekend break. The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom very modern and a very good sized shower for two! The location was ideal for a city break in Venice and close to San Marco square which made it convenient but not too close for noise or crowds. A canal runs on 2 sides of the hotel and the hotel restaurant (where breakfast was served) was a large, beautiful terrace on the canal as well. We made our own way to the hotel from the airport on a water taxis, which was an experience and the hotel was a 5 minute walk through the narrow streets from the Rialto stop, but great with a case on wheels! Venice is a very beautiful city and a must to see at least once. The only downside is because of it's popularity it is expensive and with the weak Â£, makes it a very expensive treat. Admittedly we did splash out and have a coffee at one of the cafes on San Marco square, which was playing music, lovely but at nearly twenty euros for the two, phew! We will definately go back, I hope and if so would want to stay at the Palace Bonvecchiati. The hotel does have an adjourning sister hotel, which is possibly not as modern as this one, but still a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ,Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sailing4
Reviews.Content: The Palace Bonvecchiati is very conveniently located about an eight-minute walk to the Grand Canal and ten minutes from St. Marks square, water taxi stops and restaurants. An included breakfast was excellent. A variety of fruits, breads and eggs, ham and bacon etc., the hotel restaurant was very attractive but the food, though good, was very expensive. The staff spoke very good English was very helpful in arranging transportation and answering questions WiFi is a hot spot, not hotel provided, fast and reasonably priced. If using I Pad check with the hotel how to purchase time, also airline-boarding passes can be printed but is somewhat cumbersome. The room was very bright, modern and comfortable with modern furnishings . Very lavish if a bit inconvenient bathroom, the room overlooked a canal. Left very early in the morning and the hotel made us a small lunch box left at the front desk. The water taxi picked us up at the hotel dock, But be warned â€“ when the water is too high they cannot bring a water taxi to the hotel so be prepared to drag your luggage through the narrow streets to the hotel as we had to do when arrived(about 8 minute walk). All on all a very convenient and pleasant hotel to stay in. To clarify, this hotel is connected physically to the separate Bonvecchiati Hotel,.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice: staff, rooms & service!”
Reviews.Author: wiseshark
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in 2 rooms; rooms were large (especially for Venice) & very comfortably furnished, lovely bath & accessories. We got great help from friendly, knowledgeable & patient reception staff - also observed them deal with some wretchedly inane & demanding guests - with calm, courtesy & poise (how can some travelers be so rude, and ill-informed?!!) Don't rely on prior poor reviews (their outdated & unfair) - staff was great- and we dealt with everyone from reception, bartenders, housekeeping & busman. Breakfast was a full meal, served buffet style in (attached) sister hotel, on lovely, outdoor terrace overlooking an active canal (great sights). We've stayed half dozen times in Venice, and highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: HOLLESLEY
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for our 40th wedding anniversary and had originally booked the Hotel Bonvecchiati but on arrival found we had been upgraded to a junior suite in the Palace Bonvecchiati. Room was excellent, a good size, very comfortable and clean. Navigating through to the shared restaurant with the Hotel Bonvecchiati was no problem and breakfast was good. Reception staff were at all times friendly, helpful and efficient; special mention goes to Ugo who went the extra mile with any requests or questions we had. A canalside table for dinner in the evening is a particularly lovely experience. Being able to take the water taxi directly from the hotel is great and we recommend paying a very little extra for a minibus to take you from the water taxi dock to the terminal - a 10 minute or so walk, but in hot weather and carrying a large piece of Murano glass it was well worth the extra!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good reception service”
Reviews.Author: LoveLuxury2
Reviews.Content: Traditional building with modern interior in a fantastic location. Great reception service (in contradiction to some other reviews) and amazing views from canal view room. Breakfast in sister hotel ok but service flustered and disorganised. Be warned, we ended up at the sister hotel by mistake when we arrived - rather than allowing us to go through to our hotel which is attached we were sent round the block with our suitcases!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: We arrived via private water taxi which dropped us right at the hotel door. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and modern. What we found to be really good was our room had a walk in wardrobe to store your luggage. We purchased via their website and got a good rate for 4 days the only extra cost was the city tax which had to be paid in cash on departure. Fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel530
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and all in all one of the better hotels. Very comfortable beds for Europe standards and friendly staff. Received a bottle of Prosecco on arrival which was a nice touch. Location of hotel is very good...close/ walking distance to everything. Room is clean and modern with a nice terrace on canal for breakfast. I would def stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Teesside_tourer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, only c.400metres from St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Rooms of moderate size, but very clean, comfortable beds and well equipped. Reception friendly, efficient and helpful. Breakfast busy, but good service, selection ok and opportunity to sit outside.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Gergoke
Reviews.Content: A small confusion in the beginning (when booking, it was never mentioned that our suite is in the Palace Bonvecchiati, which is the "sister" hotel of Hotel Bonvecchiati, so when double-checking before our arrival, first we were told that we don't even have a reservation... but it was cleared up in a minute or two). Hotel is in a very convenient location, central, but quiet. The room was very spacious, clean and elegant. Bathroom was perfect too. Even had a walk-in wardrobe. The staff was very helpful and cheerful. They even ran around the neighboring shops to organize a birthday cake and have as a surprise at dinner for my darling. The gondola picked us up on the hotel's doorstep. We payed the previously quoted price, no surprises with the bill. All in all, I would recommend this place to everyone, even if it is a bit pricy, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “So Good We Went Back”
Reviews.Author: barrule
Reviews.Content: Visted Palace Bonvecchiati for the third time in March this year. The hotel suits our needs. Upon arrival we were shown to our room which did not have a bath only a shower. I returned to Reception and asked for a room with a bath to be told the hotel was full. I informed the clerk that we had made the booking some nine previuos and did not want just a shower. After some muttering we were given a room with a bath. This is the only trouble we have ever had in this hotel and the clerk we dealt with we have never seen before. We did complain about him. The rest of the staff were great and extremely polite and helpful. Yes we will go back again it is such a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of additions to the bill after you leave....”
Reviews.Author: travel4lifenow
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we though we found the hotel to be ok, we were shocked at an additional fee on our credit card a month after we returned. Evidently we have been accused of taking 2 hangars. We did not, we actually brought our own. This cost of over $30 for just 2 hangers outweighs any good comments and I find outrageous. Some housekeeper has a lovely closet, and the hangar company has quite a mark up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: MacDude23
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 1 night and got upgraded to a junior suite which is very nice of them, great room, beautiful and with a small view on the canal! We weren't too impressed by the appearance of the reception and elevator for a 'palace', it was just average but again, the room made up for it. Internet wasn't free which I thought wasn't normal for a hotel of that price but it seems like it s often the case in Venice. They have 1 computer in the lobby. Breakfast was OK but nothing special and not cozy as you are in a big room sharing with hundreds of guests from 2 hotels. With a discount I d go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Boomer62
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION! This property is located halfway between Rialto bridge and San Marco Square. Hotel is very clean, and the staff is excellent and very helpful, especially Ugo the night manager, her gave us some great ideas fro visiting several landmarks and included excellent directions. The hotel also has deals on guides and transportation to the outer islands such as Murono and Lido, and they leave directly from the hotel by water taxi. Nothing is cheap but you can find good food for reasonable prices if you do your research, I will review the restaurants we ate at separately. Brunch at the hotel was very good and included in the price of your stay so take advantage. The room was very clean and comfortable, we only sleep there so it was adequate, not very roomy but again we were just sleeping in it. Tip, run the shower at half pressure as the basin had a tendency to overflow as the drain is quite small. We arrived at night and if you have never been to Venice before, being an island presents it's own set of problems. It is not accessible road, so I recommend the water taxi direct from the airport, it will save you dragging suitcases down narrow walkways looking for the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: esthercbuenosaires
Reviews.Content: everyhting was perfect. The rooms, location, atention. I really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation/location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Travellove4
Reviews.Content: This light and modern hotel was a welcome in the heat when we arrived. We came by water taxi direct to the door - very convient it you have kids and (to much) luggage. The people at the reception were very helpful and our rooms were spacious and very clean. The bathrooms are very modern and nice. The location is excellent, because it is in the middle between the Rialto and St Marco Square. The breakfast was good, but not enough tables for both hotels. We shall for sure go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, amazing location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucasSantos
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for iur honeymoon twice, first before our cruise when we get a Junior suite with a shared balcony, but no one ever use it, so it was always empty. For the second time we get another Junior suite with a walk in closet very nice as well. The staff was great, specially Hugo that helped us with everything and who speaked portuguese! The location is amazing really close to san marco and with nice gellatos around.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, contemporary, with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: steampunkcat
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for swathes of Venitian fabrics, renaissance-inspired furniture and Murano chandeliers, you're in the wrong place. This is a modern, fresh, minimalist hotel, in a great base location in the San Marco region of Venice. There are two 'Bonvecchiati' hotels in Venice, next door to each other: the 'standard' hotel (Bonvecchiati Hotel) and the deluxe 'Palace Bonvecchiati'. Make sure you know which you're going to, as it may mean arriving at the wrong entrance! Our water taxi dropped us, quite literally at the front door - we climbed from the boat using the hotel's handrail and took two steps and were inside! This entrance would definitely not be suitable for anyone with a physical impairment, so it would be better to be dropped off on land and walk to the street-facing entrance. The receptionist was very efficient, with the porter ready and waiting without prompting. The suite was enormous, with electronic plain key entry, and a walk-in-wardrobe, double bathroom, and large living area. Wi-fi was â‚¬12 for 12 hours of use, that's IN TOTAL not 'as much as you like within the next 12 hour period', which was excellent value for European hotels. The bed was wonderful quality, with divine pillows. There were I believe four Italian channels, one German, one French, one Spanish, one Russian and two english on the TV, with on-demand movies. The hotel surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne, which was a lovely touch. The only downsides were the breakfast - the range was ok, but little things weren't in place, like the milk/hot water being empty, and some food like the breakfast cakes/pastries being left uncovered for the birds to come and land on. The service at breakfast was non-existant - I didn't get one 'good morning' from any of the waiting staff bar the maitre d' the whole time I ate there. The other slightly negative aspect was the room carpet - everything else in the room was spotless, but there were a few fairly large unpleasant-looking stains on the carpet, which was very off-putting as they were near the bed. Overall, I'd give Palace Bonvecchiati a 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: jrluv2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 15 days in Italy, of all the hotels that we stayed the most memorable will be Palace Bonvecchiati, from the moment we checked in and Sabrina took us personally to our room, to the day we left. I can honestly say that we have never been provided with such special service. This hotel has a 4 star rating. The truth is that it should be rated a high five. Amazing service, unforgettable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Auroraam
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo Bonvecchiati with its handsome modern decor. Our attractive room was large with a large walk in closet and large and comfortable bathroom. It couldn't have been nicer. The service was great. Reception obtained tickets for us to go to the Ensemble di Vivaldi to hear beautiful music in the oldest church in Venice and to the Palazzo et Musica to hear extraordinary opera duets in the beautiful old palace. They recommended dinner at El Forno, which we enjoyed. We enjoyed breakfasts in the hotel breakfast room overlooking one of the small canals. As has been mentioned, the location is fantastic--a direct 5 minute walk to the Rialto and a 7 minute walk to San Marco. We really loved our visit to Venice and our stay here. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: DespinaC
Reviews.Content: the hotel is centrally located between the rialto bridge and piazza st.Marco making it ideal to visit Venice. The rooms are large and very comfortable. If you are looking for a modern decorate hotel then this is for you. If you want something with color local look elsewhere. On the down side, the breakfast area is shared with the hotel bonvecchiati, which is the sister hotel, that is cheaper than the Palace. This means that the breakfast room was quite full and we had to wait in line for about 5-7 minutes to get scrambled eggs. You had a large choice of items but poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “A truly excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mac082
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel are spot on.The location is perfect the staff are incredibly helpful and the rooms are superb.The restaurant is a little pricey but the food is very good. The all inclusive breakfast is also excellent.We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and ambience for a dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: Opinion8ted
Reviews.Content: My family of three booked a triple room at Palace Bonvecchiati through an online travel service for a two night stay. The hotel is perfectly located between Piazza San Marco and the Rialto bridge on one of the more major pedestrian streets, Calle dei Fabbri. First time visitors are often concerned about how to get to their hotels with luggage. We arrived on the Alilaguna water bus from the airport (this is the best way to do it, costing 13 euro per person), hoofing it across the piazza, through the clock tower's street opening, and north to the hotel in less than ten minutes. It is an even shorter walk from the Rialto where there is a large public vaporetto dock --and the #2 is fast and convenient to and from the train station. From the hotel's location, you can do anything and go anywhere. This hotel is very modern, lots of elegant marble and stainless steel in the public areas, with a friendly staff. We were immediately upgraded to a large "executive" room with a king bed, a comfortable single and a capacious bathroom. The breakfast is typical,with lots of options. I emailed the hotel before our arrival and was able easily to arrange restaurant recommendations and reservations; although the first dining recommendation out of the box was the same place they all recommend to tourists, a little probing got us a fish restaurant in Canareggio with only one other table of Americans -- quite remarkable. the hotel can also arrange a gondola ride right from their dock behind the hotel, but it's 130 euro, and you can negotiate a better price at one of the gondola stands (we reccommend going at about 4:30 pm when the canals are pretty quiet and the slanting sunlight makes for romantic photos). It was great to get away from the Grand Canal and the Piazza - thought both remain close by - for quiet nights at a lovely, lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning. The only place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: roz1956
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay, with partner, or family member. So convienient. 1 min to St Marco, or 1min to Rialto bridge,, where you catch the boat to the train station. Friendly service, helpful, and what a clean modern hotel. Staff professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter3101
Reviews.Content: Reception were friendly and helpful, the room was excellent and the complementary breakfast was surprisingly good, unless you wanted an egg of some sort, in which case the wait in the queue was really not worth it. The steam room and saunas were very good, but needed to be booked in advance (so that you aren't disturbed?). Although bizarre, this was not a problem. Our area of greatest concern before arriving was how we would find the hotel in the maze of alleyways that is Venice. We took an Alilaguna Line Blu to San Marco and managed to find the hotel with little difficulty following a Google map. We could also have taken an Orange (Arancia) line to Rialto if we had arrived slightly earlier and this would have been a shorter trip. The weather during our stay was clear, but cold, but the room was a bit too warm. We asked and were advised that, in March, the heating is on, but no airconditioning. So we left some windows open at night to cool the room down. This worked but had the disadvantage in the morning that we did not need an alarm call, as the bin barges do their circuits quite early and are noisy. There was also building work going on in a neighbouring building which meant rubble being thrown from a great height into another barge. But we were awake anyway....more or less.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: GPA12345
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean hotel. Lobby is modern and spacious, Rooms are very large for the standards in Venice. Bathrooms are also spacious, modern and have a large shower. Bathrobes, slippers, mini bar everything you need. Beds are very comfortable. There was even a seating area in our room with double beds. Very very large walk in closet. Excellent when staying in Venice for multiple nights. Built in hairdryer is not the best, I would bring my own next time. You will hear noise from the canal below during the night and morning hours. The staff is not very helpful. For example we asked how to get to Ca' Pesero (museum). He gave us directions, we set off on our way, arrived at the museum to find it is closed on Monday. It would have been nice for him to look up the hours of operation for us. For the price of the room, staff should go the extra mile. WiFi is not included, but is reasonably priced, however, did not work when we tried to purchase it. Breakfast was included and is quite a plentiful buffet. Fitness center was great to have. There are four machines, two bikes, tradmill, and eliptical. Spa area is quite small but very nice. Overall you will be happy with your stay becuase the rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, Horrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: cardak1990
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the rooms have wonderful views. The location is right in the middle of great restaurants and little shops. The hotel breakfast was delicious. The staff, on the other hand, is very rude and self centered. We went on our trip as leisure, however, we were expecting some business calls. We gave our secretary the number of the hotel but not the room number because we did not know it yet. When she tried to contact us she was told that we were not at that hotel. An hour later she called and spoke to someone different who told her that we were there then hung up on her. When she called again the man at the front desk acted as though he did not speak English and couldn't understand her than hung up. After waiting around for our call we decided to contact the front desk to see if we had missed any messages or calls. We were assured that no one had attempted to contact us. We called our secretary from the hotel phone using are credit card and she told us her problems. When we went down stairs to talk to the manager we were informed that there wasn't one on shift and wouldn't be one till we left, how convent for them! I would not recommend this hotel to any one who values good customer service. As far as Venice goes, it is all tourists. There were no locals and every one spoke English. All the restaurants menus were in English, except for the very upscale ones. Venice is a beautiful place but very expensive. Going in the winter was nice because there were no lines and cold there is low 40's. The biggest down fall of Venice is that I felt as though I never left America.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - indiffferent staff.”
Reviews.Author: educated_traveller49
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very tasteful and well worth its luxury status. However, we found the staff indifferent and reluctant to go the extra inch to help out in need. For example, we arrive well past midnight because our flight was delayed and there was absolutely NOTHING available for us to eat. The reception staff were simply not interested. Generally speaking, it is a stylish, tasteful hotel however I wouldn't want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glb7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Bonvecchiati because some friends recommended it. Overall, the Hotel was excellent. It is in a great locations - about a 5 minute walk from St. Marks square and about 8 minutes to the Rialto Bridge. The rooms are extremely modern but very comfortable. Our room was quite large. The staff was inconsistent. The housekeeping staff was very good. The front desk staff was very helpful at times and sometimes very snooty. It really depended on the person. Once I figured this out, I tried to go to the people who helped. The staff that was helpful made some wonderful suggestions for out of the way places to eat. The one real weakness is the breakfast. This was our fourth and last stop on our Italian trip. Every place had breakfast and this was not even close to the other three. The food was mediocre and I felt like I was in a busy, noisy cafeteria. Overall, we recommend this hotel. We just recommend eating breakfast out.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allophane
Reviews.Content: They gave us an upgrade! Good location and good value for Venice E175 euro. This is better than our usual middle of the road hotel. You need a map to do the 10 minute walk from the canal. Very good buffet breakfast. Usual TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent... everything”
Reviews.Author: jbamail
Reviews.Content: We were really astounded to find this hotel of such great quality in Venice for such reasonable prices. It was, in our opinion, perfectly located - close to the canal and Pzza. S. Marco but in a quiet side street. The room was extra large and beautifully furnished, the bathroom was large, the breakfast was amazing (the breakfast room was a little chaotic but the service and selection were first rate) and the front desk was incredibly helpful and professional. We really felt that we had stayed in a hotel that belonged to a much higher price/star category. We would love to return when next in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: VarunStuti
Reviews.Content: ->Great location.. 2 mins walk for rialto and max 3-4 mins walk for san marco... -> Good rooms with all the modern amenities -> Nice buffet breakfast. -> Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Just Great !”
Reviews.Author: nisreen-a
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and 2 sons (Aged 8 and 12) for 3 nights, we booked two connecting rooms, The rooms were modern chick, attention to details was amazing, my two sons found two small bathrobes for them in their rooms ! It is an amazing place to stay while visiting venice, the only thing that the hotel can improve is the breakfast service that frankly is not in the same level of the rest of hotel facilities and services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TallDadTim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location for walking to all major sights. No view from our room, but it was comfortable. After a day of walking amongst all the other tourists we wished that our hotel had of had a more welcoming lounge. The communal areas of this hotel let it down. The smell of the lilies left me hunting for my ventolin. The beds are really comfortable, the shower was new, powerful and hot. The staff are helpful and generally polite. The breakfast was basic but just about ok. All In all we would recommend this hotel. The breakfast is basic but works, a slight shame that the fruit is for display only.....

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: srb1256
Reviews.Content: My wife and I only stayed for 2 nights late October. We had decided to splurge on this small part of an 18 night trip. It was one of the most spectacular hotels we have stayed in around the world. One bonus was we received a room upgrade, which I am sure added to our enjoyment. Our room was a huge double, with a beautiful view of the bell tower. The bed was luxurious, the bathroom was nicer than our house, and the room was quiet (until the bells rang). The service was 5 star - especially but not limited to Ugo, who can recommend great restaurants and joke in several languages ;-). The buffet breakfast was truly a meal to keep you all day. The fresh baked pastries, meats, cheeses, fruits, cereals, drinks and cappuccino were all extraordinary. We did have one dinner at the restaurant as well which was good but not showstopping (the music was terrible, however). I do not know what else to say - if you can afford it, you will not be disappointed. The location - 200 yards from Piazza San Marco, and about a 5 minute walk to the Ponte Rialto, was perfect in my opinion. In a city of very expensive hotels, one would have to call this a reasonable value. If I had to say something less positive, it would be that it has no view of the Grand Canal. But, it probably smells better in the summer as a result! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in 17th century wrapper”
Reviews.Author: JoeFormaggio
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, up-to-date hotel in the heart of Venice. Enormous room. Very quiet. Five minutes from Piazza San Marco and Rialto bridge. Private pier for water taxi. Abuts its sister hotel, the Hotel Bonvecchiati. (Makes for some confusion upon arrival, but it's easily corrected.) The hotels share a restaurant, where you'll have breakfast. Finding it involves some twists and turns, but you just follow the signs, like everywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, lovely hotel in a perfect spot.”
Reviews.Author: singerlady
Reviews.Content: What a lovely, elegant hotel with very nice staff. Traveled with my adult children and they were as impressed as I was. The breakfast is in the hotel Bonvecchiati which is the sister hotel. You can get to it via the Palace but I found it easier to go out the front door and down the street. The hotel is in a perfect spot-right in the middle. St. Mark's to the right and Rialto ridge and Grand Canal to the left. Great breakfast. Hotel staff very attentive. We had three rooms the room had was way too small for a king size bed, and the bathroom was even smaller. This room would have been fine for a single person and it needed a double bed. The other two rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were fine. I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “this is the best hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: millydan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days, after a 7 day cruise to turkey, and greece. At the time of booking i didnt realize that the stay in Venice would be the highlight of the holiday. We stayed here with my partner and 3 year old daughter, and couldn't fault the hotel at all. Fantastic decor, spotlessly clean, lovely staff, fantastic breakfast - everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, beautiful, helpful, clean and in the center of EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: dcdavis2
Reviews.Content: I did a great deal of research on lodging in Venice before booking at this hotel. I had high expectations already, but when I arrived, even my highest expectations were surpassed by the professionalism of the staff, appearance of the hotel, size of the rooms and bathrooms, and cleanliness of the property. And on top of it all, it took me 4 minutes flat to walk to San Marco Square from the hotel. The rest of Venice is easily accessible by foot, water taxi, or gondola from the hotel. This hotel is a modern boutique design hotel with beautiful rooms, comfortable beds, and friendly, helpful staff. The price is more than reasonable for what you're getting. You're making a mistake if you book anywhere else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “I don't need more than this-..”
Reviews.Author: reido50
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of Venice, concierege knows everything. Excellent variety of breakfast in a beautiful space. Comfortably chic, say hi to the bartender.

Reviews.Title: “stylish,chic spotless Italian boutique in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: mpjGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise.You will need to get a water taxi or take the vaporetto (water bus 5 euros) to the rialto stop and walk 150 yards.Its easy to get lost in Venice so staying at a hotel near a landmark like the Rialto is is good.The hotel was one of the best we have stayed in.(2 adults and a 10 year old for 270 euros b&b per night)The size of the triple room was gigantic by most standards.This was modern and elegant with everything to the highest standard.You have breakfast in the sister hotel bonvecchiati next door(interconnected) on its terrace .the 2 hotels contrast designer against old world and work really well along side on another.The front staff are very helpful and will recommend trips sights restaurants etc.We took our own gondola ride in the afternoon.Tip.All gondolas(400+) are owned by the one company so you can only negotiate the price to a certain level.We paid 80euros for about 40 minutes and felt it was well worth it.San Marcos is only 5 minutes walk so the location is perfect.You are surrounded by restaurants but take your time picking one because they are not all good.overall this was the perfect hotel and spot in Venice to stay for a few days.Getting back to the Marco polo airport is either by water taxi or go to Piazzale Roma 3 euros by bus. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MrAndMrsFoodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my 30th and the hotel upgraded us to a suite. The room was really nice, clean and cosy. It is in a great location. Its sits between Rialto and St. Marks Square - and both are within about 5 mins walking distance, allowing you to get to the water taxi's / buses and main points of interest quickly. Its quiet atmospheric meandering through the little alleys and cobbled streets around the hotel excited about what you might stumble upon. There are some good restaurants nearby which are reasonably priced compared to others in Venice. The staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: UnicornGR
Reviews.Content: Just a single word "AWSOME". I want to thank everyone at the hotel. They are fantastic people. Thanks Hugo. I'll come back for sure. Best regards, Antonios Peridis

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2LOUNGE
Reviews.Content: After a dissapointing hotel experience in Florence, walking into our hotel room here was like PARADISE! The furnishing are very modern and posh and we had beautiful views of the streets from all sides. The bathroom was HUGE with very nice amenities, however, the shower itself was a bit awkward and ended up flooding half the bathroom every time you used it. Bed was super comfy. We also used the whirpool and steam room one afternoon which was great after walking all day and getting lost about a dozen times. :0) Front desk was very helpful with dinner arrangements and such. Bit of advice: If you want a Gondola ride DO NOT have them pick you up from the hotel. Although very cool that they can do that, the pricing was 2x higher than what we heard a gondola ride should cost. We ended up going to some of the main gondola areas and paid half as much. Same with the water taxi to the airport. We would have spent over 100 euros just to get to the airport, instead we took the water taxi which is a three minute walk from the hotel. Overall a great stay. We would go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel which I would strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: maichimidu
Reviews.Content: Modern high quality hotel. Spacious quite room with large modern bathroom. Breakfast was very good and staff were friendly and helpful. I have stayed in a lot of city hotels and this ranked very well. I would have no hestiation in recommending it to family and friends.Better than my previous experiences of Italian hotels. Excellent location between Rialto and San Marco Square. Nice room, very clean and rather rare for an Italian hotel: modern. Staff extremely friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: wpgjet51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more modern than most hotels in the USA or Canada. Great location only 5 minute walk from Piazza St Marco and from Rialto Bridge. Some rooms have view of canal. Very good breakfast included but wi-fi is extra charge of 24 Euro /day

Reviews.Title: “The concierge makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: Hajfisk
Reviews.Content: You don't find bargains in Venice but here you have a very decent hotel for your bucks. We stayed in a deluxe room, which was quite basic but with all the amenities you need and a very nice bathroom. The room was very spacious. Ask the concierge Ugo about anything and he will help you. Very good restaurant recommendation and feeling for what the guest could be interested in. He knows Venice! The others at the desk wasn't that on top of things, maybe due to there englich capabilities. Breakfast a bit ordinary but suffiicent. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest about the prices and rude service. View onto dirty backyard.”
Reviews.Author: eoch12
Reviews.Content: Stay if you don't mind prices, paying for extras and RUDE service and need a clean room in a good location. Otherwise there are many more charimng better hotels around in venice. Does not keep up with the other four star hotels in Venice. Otherwise it was a good location, clean. Do not go for the spa-it is not a spa,the jacuzzi was out-of-service and sauna and steam-rooma nd jacuzzi all require separate prebooking and payment of 20euros for 30mins. The internet is not free either. The Bonvecchiati Palace website was not working at the time of booking so I called up and was quoted a price for a deluxe room (according to the reservations this was the only one available). An hour later my husband managed to get onto the website whereupon we discovered that there were four superior rooms available at an average of 200 euros per night when we had been quoted 270 euroes per night. We called the hotel to explain what had happened and were told not to worry and that when we arrived we could have a refund (we were made to pay the first night up front). On arriving at the hotel we were met by abnoxious and arrogant staff at the reservations who told us that if we wanted a cheaper hotel rate we could go to the bad and breakfast next door and tried to worm their way out of refunding the excess. This continued for 15minutes at which point I asked for an alternative- an upgrade; this, i was told, would be possible the next day. The next day I was met with the same abnoxious and evasive treatment. We stayed at the hotel because they threatened to charge us for the nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairefox203
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated between Rialto bridge and St Marks Square. It took us some time to find as we were first time visitors and not conversant with the maze of streets.....but we got there eventually!! On arrival we were greated by Ugo who was very accomodating and helpful. As were al other staff throughout our stay. The rooms are very well equipped and were well maintained during our stay. The walk in closet was a nice edition!! The bathroom was immaculate. The bed was huge and had a thin duvet but there were heating controls in our room so we were not cold!! There was a small flatscreen TV in the room which only had a couple of news channels (admittedly you don't go to venice to watch TV!!) . There was a mini bar in the room which was very expensive, personally I would have prefered tea and coffee making facilties which are not provided. Breakfast was well presented and consisted of an array of cereals, breads and pastries, cheeses and meat and a rather poor cooked breakfast of egg and cooked ham. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a modern, clean hotel in a good location. You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “No cars in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Helenblack123
Reviews.Content: rhis location is close to St Mark Sq. From here it is easy to walk Venice. This is a nice size hotel of about 100 rooms. Style and furnishings venetian. This hotel also has an all suites facility,

Reviews.Title: “Unconditionally to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Jones_10
Reviews.Content: After searching for the perfect place to stay in Venice among the numerous hotels (of obscure quality) prior arrival I trusted the recommendations of others who stayed here before me and my expectations were exceeded. Very chic, remarkably clean (especially considering italian standards), well located. The concierge Ugo was more than just friendly and helpful, simply outstandingly accomodating. If I'd ever come back I'd definitely stayed at the Palace Bonvecchiati again. It was a great trip thanks to the wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard A
Reviews.Content: Great location between Rialto and St Mark's Square, both within a 3 - 5 minute walk. Lovely rooms, very clean and well appointed. Flat screen TV, shower and safe all within our room. Was upgraded upon arrival, no ideas why but did not argue !! Booked through Octupus Travel - very efficient and no problems with booking in. Friendly staff who kept their distance, which was lovely. Breakfast was buffet style with lots of options. Used the public water buses, which were cheap and took you to Rialto or St Mark's Square www.venicelink.com as opposed to the private water taxis, which were very expensive (95 euros each way). Would recommend this hotel. One downside is that the restuarant and bar seemed expensive so did not sue but loads of options within a five minute walk. Brilliant place and well worth a visit - if went back to Venice would stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cunsel
Reviews.Content: first hotel in the middle of Rialto and saint marco square,2 minutes walk to both places can be contacted. Although the functional and cute little lobyy. modern and spacious rooms are furnished. bathroom very clean and well maintained. I think the hotel's breakfast would be a little richer,but was still delicious results of this romantic place in the Venetian hotel in this romance is definitely keeping up. If you have a girl friend with you to go and easily accepted here, and this romantic city can remove the taste of utmost

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room We've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: haba_tsutt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palace Bonvecchiati between 15-18 Jan 2010. Booked a Superior room for three nights through hotels website directly I must say that this was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in (and I have about 60 hotel nights/year in work). Unfortunately I didn't have a measuring tape with me but aprox. 3*3 meters + a small hallway and a fairly big toilet ~ aprox. 20 sqm in total. "View" towards the courtyard. On the top level. Very nicely decorated and the material choices are from the more expensive end. Elegant and modern. Pros: - location as earlier rewievs states - breakfast included (average+) - personnel were helpful Cons: - A bit overpriced for the standard - the cleaning personnel had their storage for cleaning equipment just outside our room (460) which made it a bit noisy in the morning. - the telephone were they got their instructions rang quite often - the size of the room - the remote to the TV didn't work A couple of general comments: nb that in the description that beds are 140cm wide really mean that a double bed is 140cm wide. At least in our room. This meant that my wife and I came close... They have a SPA "department" as well but we didn't use it because of the pricing. 20â‚¬ / 30 minutes of Sauna would ruin a guy with Finnish origin. The photographer that pictured the rooms was a professional ;) In total I can say that the location saved our total impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveenemean
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and in a good location. It was close to the Rialto bridge and some pretty good restaurants. The place right across from the hotel and to the right (cannot remember the name) was excellent. Highly recommend it. The rooms were nice. We were upgraded to a suite because it was our honeymoon. Staff was very helpful and friendly and even called us the day we were leaving to make sure we knew about high tide. They also set up a tour to Murano island to see the glass factory for us for free. The rooms were clean and cozy. Only bad thing was the price. It was a little pricey but worth it for the suite we got. Not sure how it would compare for the regular rooms (what we actually paid for but did not see).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and staff...but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Britt
Reviews.Content: The room was exceptionally clean and well stocked. Our room had a modern vibe and decor. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The overall apperance of the hotel was elegant and inviting! I would recommend a stay at this hotel for romantic couples visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WendyDub
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a 5 minute walk to San Marco piazza and a 5 minute walk to the Realto bridge so in terms of location it's great, when it comes to the rooms they were on the small side but nonetheless very nice and clean and the bathroom was perfect except I got a shower when I wanted a bathtub, breakfast was ok, nothing special but you would expect them to know how to make a good cappuccino which they didn't know,the staff were more on the rude side and when I'm staying in a 4 star hotel and paying top dollar I expect at least a smile which none of the front desk staff managed to crack but instead all I got was a grumpy man and lady who seemed not to bother with service. All in all I would advice that if you get a good rate then definitely stay here, if you pay their published rates then I would recommend you stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Italy 2009”
Reviews.Author: TroyM1
Reviews.Content: The nicest Hotel we stayed in our entire trip!!! The best time to travel was in late fall, we looked into returning for the honeymoon - but may looked very expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nadger79
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We got it cheap on an expedia offer, and when we arrived couldn't believe our luck! 3 minutes walk from St Mark's square MAX! My only complaint was that it was a bit hard to find and the hotel down the street is also called the palace Bonvecchitati!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault â€“ top notch”
Reviews.Author: drjohn_Galan
Reviews.Content: A modern, smart, elegant, well run hotel located almost midway between St Markâ€™s square and the Rialto Bridge. Could not fault the room: well equipped, good size and well serviced. The well-trained, friendly staff at the desk (who all spoke good English) could not have been more helpful, whether it be advising on restaurants, trips to the lagoon islands or how high the tide will be. Could not recommend it more highly. (NB if booking a water taxi in advance, do not pay â€“ at a premium â€“ for them to take you directly to the hotel; they will drop you near to the Rialto Bridge and you have to walk â€“ not far â€“ from there). .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwousa
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights and had 3 rooms. All were clean and modern. Clean and new bathrooms and a very good size. The staff was very helpful and breakfast was good. It did cost more than some hotels we stayed at but I would gladly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, contemporary, comfy, but small.”
Reviews.Author: hotheels
Reviews.Content: We checked in with no problems. The hotel decor is very modern and contemporary. Our room was small but very comfy. One thing you have to watch out for is even if you leave your room for 15 minutes make sure you lock your personal belongings up in the safe. We had just gone out to grab some quick food and came back to find that our room was visited by housekeeping. I think they come several times a day. The breakfast in the morning is pretty good with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel, Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: RugbyLass15
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel in Venice. Followed the directions to get off at the Railto stop and walk straight ahead into alley opposite. Very easy to find and excellent location close to St Marks and Railto bridge. Very modern and clean hotel. Stayed in a superior (which means standard) room this was very dissapointing. A very small room, with no natural light or view. Felt like a white shoebox!! Breakfast was good with a nice selection of cooked, pastries, cereals, yoghurt etc. Venice isn't cheap and expect to pay a service charge of 12% for most restaurants and cover (bread) of 3 euros. Gondolas are worth a trip but choose carefully where and when you go for a trip, expect to pay 80-100 euros. Venice is unique and beautiful place in which you can walk and see many fantastic places, felt very safe and would reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but beware of their tricks!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennydinoia8
Reviews.Content: i WOULD recommend this hotel. it is absolutely beautiful and in a great location. BUT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! their service was VERY QUESTIONABLE. i'm writing this review for people who may stay here for a small amount of time. my boyfriend and i decided to book a really nice hotel for venice and this was it. we only stayed for one night and when we got there the guy behind the counter tried to rip us off. he said "oh....you're only staying for 1 night.....okay.....so....we are going to upgrade you". we were like AWESOME. so he walks us over another street and brings us to this crappy hotel he says is PB's "sister" hotel. it was 'nice' but not the modern, slightly pricey hotel i booked AND wanted. i told him i wanted to stay in the more modern hotel and he said that we would like this one better. so i said, "please show me the room in the modern hotel 1st". he then brought us to the room, which was SOOOOOOOOO small. the bathroom had bars in the shower and was meant for a wheelchair. the bed was small and cramped and it was NOT like the pictures AT ALL. i was very dissappointed especially since i was expecting a beautiful modern room. this was THE MOST expensive place i booked on this "italian vaca" so i was expecting amazing. we ended up arguing for awhile and found out he was trying to boot us out of our room since we were only staying for 1 night. SO BEWARE! if my boyfriend didn't speak italian we would've been out of luck and paying more for nothing. Palace Bonvechiatti is a gorgoeous hotel and everyone should stay at it BUT just beware of the tricks of the desk guy because he tried to rip us off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean & new hotel, but a bit pricey! 4.5 to 5 star quality.”
Reviews.Author: mtec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August. We took a water taxi from the train station to the hotel and got dropped off at the older Hotel Bonvecchiati as we did not know our hotel was actually the PALACE Bonvecchiati. They are right next to each other so it wasn't really an issue. PROS: The hotel staff is very courteous & well trained. We arrived around noon and our room wasn't ready until 2pm, so they stored our luggage for us. The hotel looks very new and very clean. The lobby was very clean, the hallways were very clean, and the rooms were very clean. The bathrooms are well stocked with amenities (lots of shampoo, conditioner, lotion, designer soaps, plenty of towels,slippers). Very strong shower (though it takes a bit of time for the water to drain when on full blast), clean toilet and bidet. The carpet in the room was very new, and the sheets and bed were very comfortable. The room had a fax machine, widescreen LCD TV, comfortable and clean furniture, and high-tech keycard entry system. CONS: pricey hotel. The network connection in my room was broken. I had a business emergency that required me to use the internet. After calling the front desk a few times, they sent the bellboy up to try to resolve the issue. They simply told me that my computer was probably 'not compatible', which was a lousy excuse. My computer has worked with every single internet connection I have ever plugged in it. It was around 11pm so I went down to the front desk. After a few minutes of complaining, the receiptionist allowed me to use the wifi free of charge for a few minutes to download my email. After I returned to the room, I tried plugging the ethernet cable in the computer again. There was a signal... that lasted 45 seconds. When I tried to sign up for hte 24 hour internet plan, the signal dissapeared and never came back again. Second complaint i have is that the narrow canal which can be seen from the room appears to also be a garbage retrieval location. Early morning, I started hearing what sounded like garbage trucks. I figured I was probably hearing things as there are no trucks in Venice. After I woke up, I discovered indeed right across from the hotel, the floor was covered with garbage bags. They cleaned everything up by noon, but it was certainly a distraction and my partner and I ended up not sleeping very well. Apart from the above two points, this hotel was defintely one of the best hotels I've stayed in in Europe. Breakfast was good and the coffee was very nice. All in all, I enjoyed this hotel because it was CLEAN and NEW, something you don't see often in Italy. If I ever go back to Venice, I would defintiely book the Palace Bonvecchiati again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Cruiky
Reviews.Content: I was initially disappointed as when we arrive at 11:30pm we were told our room had been given to somebody else, but they had moved us to their sister hotel around the corner. The sister hotel was pleseant enough but nothing special. When we returned the next day we were upgraded to a junior suite for the rest of our stay. The room was excellent, kept spotlessly clean, and the staff were extremely helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again, but maybe ring ahead next time if I'll be arriving late.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be back”
Reviews.Author: barrule
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have recently returned from another stay in the Palace Bonvecchiati. The hotel is just simply great and nothing is a trouble to the staff. It is also nice to be greeted "Welcome back". Unfortunately due to the tides we have not been able to arrive at the door by water taxi but as it is only a short walk to the hotel from the Rialto we do not let this spoil our stay. The hotel is ideally situated between San Marco and the Rialto

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Air Conditioned, Comfortable & Great Sized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: boshamore
Reviews.Content: I found that the hotel was clean and modern. It is a non smoking hotel but as a smoker I was accomadated with a very good sized balcony to smoke from. (Enough space for deck chairs and tables ect - plus not many balconies in venice) I found the room to be of a very good size as well. Full double + seating area nicely spaced. The air conditioning is brilliant - you will really appreciate it! Breakfast is a continental affair, cereals, yogurts, pastries, eggs and bacon, fresh fruit juices, fruit, crossaints, sweet breads ect as well as a range of teas including earl grey! I would not get anything from the hotel bar though, a whisky & coke would have worked out as15 euros. Get your booze from duty free on the way in. Location is very practical - the bascila & doge palace etc is only 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. Staff are happy enough to give you directions as well which is very helpful as the streets are like a maze. You will need a map.Staff also seemed very helpful and polite. They all seemed to comfortably speak a range of languages with the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfingmd
Reviews.Content: Just back from Venice. The Palace Bonvecchiati was great. Great central location. The hotel very modern. Room was large, bed very comfortable, great bathroom. Was able to pull right up to the hotel in a water taxi. Front desk staff was great, very helpful with any questions or requests. Great A/C unlike some other places I had been. Adequate breakfast included. Not great by american standards but pretty much the standard included hotel breakfast everywhere you go in Europe. I would definitely stay here again. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: QdogBocaRaton_FL
Reviews.Content: First, the bad news. If you've never been to Venice (like we hadn't), this hotel (like all others) is very hard to find. Once you find it, you realize how convenient it is to everything (halfway between the Rialto and San Marco water bus stops). The rooms (we had a separate one for the kids) were beautiful, spacious, and very comfortable; the staff was very helpful, and the fitness room, while it had only three machines, had three very good machines and was also very spacious. We enjoyed our stay here very much, and will definitely stay here the next time were are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best service & location”
Reviews.Author: Ozi10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Palace Bonvecchiati and thought it was the best hotel we had stayed in in Italy (travelled through Rome, Tuscany & Florence). The staff were friendly and accomodating. Infact when we checked out they offered us a free trip by private water taxi to Murano. When we mentioned that we could not go because we had taken our laundry around the corner to the laundromat and had to pick it up before they closed, they kindly offered to pick up the laundry for us and store our luggage - now that's service as we had aleady checked out (and the trip to Murano was worth it!). The rooms are very large by European standards with huge modern bathroom. We had lovely view over the canal which can get a little noisy at times but that is part of the lovely atmosphere of Venice. The position is perfect - very central, only minutes from Rialto and San Marco. It is surrounded by lovely shops and delis. Breakfast was sufficient - don't expect a banquet - just the basics. I would definitely rate this as a 4-5 star hotel with prices not as high as some of the larger 5 star hotels on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Venice - One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Elmolino
Reviews.Content: Having spent our 30th wedding anniversary at the Palace Bonvecchiata Hotel we were overwhelmed by the excellence of this hotel which is situated in the heart of Venice. Hotel is very central and literally minutes from St Mark' Square and Rialto Bridge. Water busses 4 minutes away for access to airport coach to Girona airport( Ryanair). Hotel is very modern and the staff are more than courteous. Beautiful Sauna/Spa/Gym on top floor. Rates very attractive at certain times of year. Highly Recommended 10 out of 10. Noel & Lucy Browne.Limerick , Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, modern, clean excellent 4 X Hotel in centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Socrates10
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3- night stay in Venice which my lovely wife booked as a surprose for me. We stayed in an excellent 4 X hotel located in the centre of Venice, the Bonvechiatti Palace which is only a 5 minute walk from both the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square the 2 hubs of Venice. The hotel is very modern, swish and beautifuly furnished and decorated. Our room was massive (certainly by venetian standards!) with a large double bed, desk with fast cable internet access, small table & chairs, a walk-in wardrobe!! and nice bathroom with very powerful showed and bath. The view from the rooms 3(!!) Windows was of a canel as well and we could lean out and watch the near-constant traffic of Gondolas passing by or watch people crossing the bridge upstream while retaining plenty of privacy. Whilst on the expensive side I would definitely recommend the hotel for the incredible location first, size and quality of the rooms and moderness of the fixtures and fittings finally. If we had any complaints it would be the lack of facilities and the continental breakfast served in the hotel is pretty basic and the usual mixure of cereals, cakes, cold meats and fruit juices. The hotel does not have a restaurent but the sister hotel just round the corner does, but even better the third best rated hotel in Venice, the A La Valiglia is right opposite the hotel (see my review of this). So thanks to the location of the Bonvechiatti Palace we had a fantastic stay in Venice, within easy reach of the major sights, Vaporetto stops and right next to on of the top restaurants in Venice which we ate out in! For anyone that can afford it I would strongly recommend the Bonvechiatti Palace hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect, more than what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Sevyka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent central location, very easy to find. It is all newly restored with modern amenities. The room we had was a deluxe double, very large compared to most Italian hotels, clean and modern. The bathroom very spacious with both a bathtub and a separate shower. Computer access, and flat tv, nice view from the window onto one of the smaller canals. Temperature control (it was pretty hot) very modern and functional. All services and amenities one would usually find in a 5 star hotel were available and included for a 4 star price. The service was impeccable, very professional.
