Breakfast, which was included, could have been better in both the quality of the food offered as well as the variety of the buffet, which was rather small... but other than that, I would recommend this hotel very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Couple of blocks from San Marco, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brianyembering
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in May, very nice hotel. We got a special deal through Hotels.com, otherwise we would not have been able to afford the place. This hotel had the largest rooms we found in Italy during our two weeks. If you go during high season, not sure this would be an ideal hotel since it is on on of the main thoroughfares between San Marco's Plaza and the Rialto Bridge, meaning there are herds of tourists walking by, especially in the morning. But, during the low season it wasn't too bad. Not many good restaurants around the hotel either since they are all tourist traps. Better to venture away from San Marco and Railto to find a good place to eat. The internet service was horrible (TV based) and expensive. The breakfast was basic but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Expat-in-Schweiz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay in Venice. We were lucky with the weather, no crowds and the perfect hotel. The Palace Bonvecchiatti is easy to locate about a 100m from the "Rialto" vaperetto stop (Do not get off at the Rialto mercato). Once you exit, the vaperetto at "Rialto", do not turn left or right (our mistake) just go straight into the alley that is ahead of you. The alley is very narrow less than 3 feet (less than 1 meter) wide. It's easy to miss. Once in the alley, look up and you will see 2 signs: San Marco (on the left wall) and calle Bembo (on the right wall). Walk straight about 100 meters and the hotel will be on your right hand side (yellow bldg with green shutters). You don't have to worry about bridges and steps if you follow my directions. The hotel staff was courteous and spoke english well. We were shown to our room (165) and that was a big disappointment. We checked in at 4:00pm and apparently it was too late so we were given a handicap room. I was unhappy because we weren't told. I made my way back to the front desk and when I asked for our room to be changed the lady that checked us in suddenly lost her perfect english. She had the stupidest look on her face and didn't know what to say. The manager came out and tried to accomodate us and couldn't do anything for the 1st night but promised to change our room on the next day. They did. They moved us to room 352. It was a very nice room, very clean, spacious, no view and like everyone else says (they can use a shower curtain in the bathroom). I will not fault them for it because most european hotels are like that. Contrary to some opinions, we thought the breakfast was good. Reading some of the reviews, I imagined a bkfst room with no windows and 2 or 3 tables. This was a large room (remember you are in venice). It had 24 tables of 2. It seats 48. Not bad for a hotel that has 70 rooms. The hotel was full and we never had a problem finding a table. We had bkfst at 8:30am and lingered til 9:15am. Everyone that came in, was shown to a table. It got busier past 9:00am. They replenished the food constantly. I am sure they would stop replenishing, the closer you got to 10:30am. The foof buffet consisted of: cereals, milk and yogurt, variety of cheeses and cold cuts, scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon, 4 or 5 different cakes, pastries (croissants, chocolate croissants, danishes...), fresh fruits and fruit salad, and bread. Their selection of bread is very very limited but then again this is Italy and they are not known for their breads. The hotel is in the perfect location. You can wander for hours and return to it in a few minutes. I would highly recommend the vaporetto pass (36, 48 or 72 hours..) You can wander and not worry about going to far. When in doubt make your way back to the canal and catch the vaperetto back. We had dinner and lunch at the Cafe Sareceno (at the foot of the Rialto Bridge). It was very good. Thank you to the reviewers that recommended the restaurant. Last but not least, if you like a good coffee, we would recommend the "cafe da dogge". From the hotel, make a left and walk straight down to the first large street (about 1 mn walk). Turn right walk over the Ponte del Lovo and it's the 1st door to your right. (It's a 2 mn walk from the hotel). If you like figs, do try their figs and chocolate chip cake. Hope you'll enjoy Venice as much as we did. We will definetely return to the Place Bonvecchiatti. I must add that their handicap room was very well equipped for a person in a wheelchair. It had room to move around and the bathroom was very spacious. It was very inconvenient for a tall person because everything is directed to someone sitting down.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, in great location!”
Reviews.Author: GETawayPEOPLE
Reviews.Content: We had a long week-end break at this hotel at the end of january, our Ryan air flight flew into Treviso Airport, so we had a half-hour coach ride from the airport, which was no problem and worth the cheaper flights into this airport. We choose this Hotel because of the reviews and photos on the TripAdvisor web-site, we found many hotels in our price range and picked this one because the location and we like a more Stylish, Modern, Boutique stye hotel. We got of the Vaporetto at Rialto bridge and found the hotel, they kindly had emailed us directions, otherwise we may have got lost, and it does take a bit of time to get used to the layout of Venice. Our room that we had bookeed was a "Deluxe" room which was very good we got a good rate of Â£88 per night, we did not have a view of the water from our room but this was not a problem. Our room was large and modern and stylish. We had Breakfast included in our price, which to be honest the food was not up to much, which was served in very small room, that had too many tables so you were sitting so close to the people beside you, it was like you were on the same table!.... As the room was so small it was not half big enough for all the hotel guests, you are lucky if you are seated straight away, and then you feel you cant enjoy a nice leisurely breakfast. Also you order your tea and coffee before you are seated and then you are sat for ages before it arrives, also the chances of getting a second lot are Zero, and the same for getting your plates cleared away. We experienced this each time we went down for breakfast. Staff in the breakfast room did nothing over and above to provide a good service, and this was the same at the front desk, some of the staff gave the impression that our basic requets were to much for them......One afternoon we arrived back to the room, and ran a bath to find our Bath towels were missing, i phoned down to the Front desk to get some brought up to our room, however the person on the other end of the phone was insistant that the Towels were there and infact they were not, she was almost argueing with me on the phone, before even checking with house-keeping, when in fact we had used the towels the day before and did not want them changed, so we hung them back up, as they did not require to be changed, however they were missing on our return. Overall we had a good stay, i would have marked the hotel a 5/5 and not the 4/5 if the general service had not let it down, we did not come across one member of staff that we felt was providing a good level of service, so that is why i have scored it down. Would i return to this hotel Yes i would, would i return to Venice NO......I have been to many city destinations and traveled alot in Italy, and in my experience, i found Venice overrated and VERY expensive, we were lucky to get a good deal on our flights and hotel, but Eating and Drinking were very expensive indeed. Even the lower-mid end resturants were pricey. We knew before that it was going to cost alot once we were there but it cost more than that i would say double what we expected ! One recomendation was a Bar that just up from the hotel on the left, you cant miss it is the only bar in this street, and we enjoyed a night-cap or two here after our meals. It had a great cocktail list, good selection of Wine and Beers, and great Music and Staff. its name is "mosquito "or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, terrific for family!”
Reviews.Author: Helene129
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. We were traveling with our two daughters so got connecting rooms (double deluxe, one with large beds, one with twin). Did not get rooms with views of canal but requested high floor so had lovely view of Venice rooftops. Don't think the canal view is worth the extra money. The rooms are awesome, esp. the corner room we had with the King bed. All modern, sparkling clean. Bathrooms are great except the fact that there's only a partial wall for the shower so you tend the spray water all over when you shower! Would be such an easy fix for them to add shower curtains. The location can't be beat, easy walk to everything. Bargain down the gondoliers (we paid 50 Euros for 1/2 hour) and be aware it's more in the evening. Rick Steve's guide to Venice is the best book with lots of valuable insider tips. Fantasy Gelato near hotel was great. Breakfast at hotel was included and huge buffet with all you could want. Staff was hugely helpful, esp. Hugo at front desk. Private water taxi to the airport only took 20 minutes door to door but cost 110 Euros for four of us with four pieces of luggage. There is a private water door at the hotel so unless the water is low you can ride up to the hotel. If not, they'll drop you off at the Rialto Bridge which is not far but be aware there are steps involved over bridges with your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 Star Hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Smiffy1982
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. I stayed there this weekend with a friend of mine. Rooms were beautiful and clean with excellent amenities. The breakfast was very nice with a great selection and available until 10.30am. The staff were super friendly and most helpful. We had a delightful stay. The hotel is a 5 minute stroll from both the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco (St. Marks Square).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location, Great view!!”
Reviews.Author: dill0
Reviews.Content: Just back from Venice with girlfriend. Were both 28 and like our quality things. Had a great experience. Hotel is very clean and modern. Booked a Delux room with canel view-well worth â‚¬190 a night. (I think room will be dearer during peak season) Bathroom had a large shower, 2 sinks and a big bath. There was also a large walk in wardrobe. Room was very spacious. Location of Hotel is just off Saint Marks sq and a few mins from Rialto. Used the spa facilities which were free to this type of room for 30 mins aday, (which is long enough), but you do need to book it. You can hear the delivery boats outside early in the morning, but I just loved the passing noises, some might not. Best thing about this Hotel is the beautiful breakfast. Large selection of pasteries, breads etc. The coffee is great too. The only thing that got to me was that there was no iron for the room. This service is provided and is excellent, but very dear; â‚¬31 for 2 shirts 1 blouse and a short dress!! But don't let this put you off; great hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bell09
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a short break in Venice which was amazing. Palace Bonvecchiati was fantastic. It was modern, clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The Breakfast was good too. In our opinion it's in a great location close to the San Marco's sqaure as well as the main shopping area, and as well as the Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, very well situated”
Reviews.Author: fatimaLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel, a few minutes away from either Railto or St Mark's square. Immaculately clean, efficient front desk. Modern and well sized rooms, very clean modern bathrooms. Although the breakfast was good, the coffee served was of a very poor quality, especially bearing in mind that we are in Italy! Sauna, whirlpool etc should be free of charge. Otherwise excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Onich
Reviews.Content: Centrally located between St Mark's Square and Rialto. We had a very nice room overlooking a small canal. The bathroom was very modern and everything was impeccably clean. The staff are very friendly and will always try and help. Breakfast in Italian hotels is normally limited but in this case it is averagely good. Only irritations for me were that they did not have a business centre so the only internet access was via the TV and quite useless; a bar without a permanent barman meaning even when you ask for one he seems to travel from another part of Venice; and we do not follow the hotels restaurant recommendation as fortunately we had a guide to explain how expensive it was ! We got a very good rate on the internet and despite the minor irritations we would be happy to go again for the position and the rooms if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Close to main attraction, excellent room”
Reviews.Author: bunnyegg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel in Feb 09. The hotel is centrally located near St. Marks (Square) and Rialto (bridge) and was easy to find. We walked from Piazza Roma (bus terminal) to the hotel and it took us at least 30mins (dragging our luggages across at least 10 bridges) or else a ferry can be catched at 6.50 euro a person incl 1 piece of luggage. The room was bright, clean, large double bed, large bathroom. It was excellent. The breakfast was not too bad, but very average. We asked the reception to recommend us a place for dinner, and they booked us this restaurant called "Do Forni". It was very expensive, 27 euro for a fish soup and it wasn't even that good!! So don't ask for their opinion unless you are loaded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: houseofeamo
Reviews.Content: Have to say everything about this Hotel was FIRST CLASS. Excellent location, 5 Mins From Rialto, even less to St. Marks. On arrival we were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was fabulous, complimentry bottle of bubbly was much appreciated. The interior of the Hotel is very classy, and our room was bright, modern, and had everything you could want to make your stay that bit special. Breakfast was excellent, with a wide variety of cold meats, fruit, cake and pastries to die for! Even had a hot Breakfast of Bacon Sausage and scrambled eggs. FULL MARKS. Have stayed in various hotels in Venice before, but given the location and ambience of the Palace Bonvecchiati, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: blessedtwice
Reviews.Content: We did an extensive review of places to stay. we read reviews , talk to others etc. we found that both the location size of the hotel ie only 70 rooms amenities services available were exactly what we were looking for. apx 5 minutes in either direction to st marks square or the rialto bridge. we email communicated with the hotel regarding both our accomodations and desires. We arrived at high tide season which creates some minor problems in navigating under the bridges. we were glad that we had arranged ahead our time with the hotel for transfers from the airport to the hotel and later to the pier for a cruise. they were very helpful in navigating all of the high tide issues and also helped in finding a piece of luggage that the airline lost. the room was fantastic. we had a view of the waterway which my wife loved. i personally prefer modern accomodations and this hotel definitely fit the bill. the staff was extremely helpful no matter what we asked or needed. the morning breakfast buffet is wonderful. more than enough variation to meet anyones needs or desires. we loved venice and staying at the palace only enhanced our visit. we definitely plan on staying here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: pattersons2820
Reviews.Content: It's hard to believe that TripAdvisor has this hotel as a 'two star'....it was 5 star all the way. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel; not a spot on any thing. The amenities in the room were incredible. The staff was wonderful; they answered all of our questions and we were greeted by everyone, not just front desk staff. The breakfast buffet was very good. The location was excellent - just a couple of minutes away from St. Mark's and all of the best shopping areas. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: KarenL
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with 3 other couples. We ALL loved this charming,elegant Hotel. Staff-always friendly, Rooms classy and spotless, amenities a nice added touch. Breakfast Buffet-perfect. One thing to change-the hairdryers!! May as well have someone blow your hair dry! :-) Thoroughly delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service”
Reviews.Author: oxman78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Bonvechiatti from September 9-11. This was part of a whirlwind trip through some of the most popular stops in Europe. This is also where I had my birthday. What we liked... SERVICE: The service at this hotel is absolutely marvellous. Christian and Alissa helped my partner arrange for a wonderful birthday experience for us. The hotel is on a small canal, so they arranged for a gondolier to pick us up and take us on a gondola ride that ended at our restaurant, Bar Centrale. The hotel helped ensure that we got one of two tables on the beautiful dock of the restaurant, right on a small canal. Further, when we came back that night Christian checked to see how we liked our gondola and dinner. We also asked him about the Vaporetto to the S. Lucia train station for the next morning as we were heading out early. We realized later that our train was twenty minutes later than we thought. That morning though, moving a bit slower since we had extra time, Christian (still working) called us to make sure we were up because he wanted to be sure we got onto the Vaporetto on time. That he remembered and wanted to check up on us was fantastic (especially after a long night at work!). It takes a lot to get a 5 out of me (both my partner and I can be picky), but this was truly 5-star service! ROOM SIZE: This was the most American hotel we stayed at in terms of the size of their standard room. Very nicely appointed with a huge walk-in closet and plenty of room to move around. LOCATION: Lovely for people who want to be in the center of it all. It's about a 4 minute walk to St. Mark's Square and 5 minutes to the Rialto bridge. It's also on a small canal, so that will help if you are arriving in style in a viciously expensive water taxi (which we did not do). LOOK & FEEL: This is a very modern, fresh hotel. Everything felt new, both the rooms and the public spaces. This is not a traditional Venetian-style hotel, but it is a very modern take on the rich colors and textures of other more traditional luxury hotels. What could have been better (these are all minor)... ROOM DECOR: Very minor...this was nicely appointed, but some of the colors didn't quite go. Some of the reds and other colors in the rooms were off. Not at all a huge deal, but we were trying to come up with something. BREAKFAST TIME: Since we were out early (out the door at 7am on the 11th), it would have been nice if the breakfast service started at 6:30. There are a number of trains that leave S Lucia station early, so it would be nice to have had that breakfast available. OVERALL... We highly recommend this hotel. Our "what could have been better" category is pretty small stuff compared to the pluses for this hotel. Great for travelers looking for luxury and not afraid of spending some $$ for a good experience. Keep in mind though that Venice is the Paris of Italy--very expensive. This hotel was one of the better deals for us.

Reviews.Title: “great luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: rekkka
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Venice..5 minutes far from san mark square and 10 minutes from rialto. The room was really nice. It was cleened twice a day.Once in the morning and once just before we went to sleep. The breakfast was good too.. various kind of food. Staff is helpful. To sum up a nice hotel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Really smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: daff201
Reviews.Content: Very elegant modern hotel. Our room was on the top floor. As usual for Venice not massive but king size bed and monsoon shower. The breakfast was good and the front desk was very helpful. Only slight gripe was when we asked about using the jacuzzi we were told you have to reserve it and it cost about 25 euros!. Apart from that very central. Literally 2 minutes from Rialto and from St Marks. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “In my top three hotels worldwide!”
Reviews.Author: simonp820
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night in August whilst on my way to attending a family wedding a few hours away. . . . and I was not disappointed. The staff were excellent, the hotel's location is perfect, the room and facilities were fantastic. Out of the door and five minutes walk left and you're at the Rialto Bridge, five minutes right and you're in the middle of St Mark's Square. Important travel tip - avoid the water taxis that are a complete rip-off (unless there are a few of you). I was charged 80EUR for a 15 minute journey from the railway station to the hotel door. The same return journey cost me 6EUR on the water bus! Would highly recommend this hotel to visitors to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Apslamppoon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 5 day trip to Venice made all the better by our choice of hotel. We were travelling with our two children, aged 11 and 16 and although we had booked two deluxe rooms, without a special request we were given rooms next to each other with connecting doors. Obviously we had paid for both children, but having travelled to many parts of the world with them, we are used to either having rooms miles apart or squeezing into two queen size beds, in even the best of hotels! The Palace Bonvecchiati couldn't be faulted on this trip. The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean, with super air conditioning, a welcome relief in the August heat! The beds were comfotable. Towels were changed where necessary, when the beds were turned down on an evening. Staff were helpful and friendly whilst maintaining a professional distance and, unlike a previous reviewer's experience, the breakfast room was over run by staff ensuring nothing ran out and tables were clean. The hotel is situated on one of Venice's narrow streets, a short walk from both St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge but don't let this put you off. It means that although some of the rooms may just have views of other buildings you're in for a quiet night's sleep! One final note - The hotel also has a sister hotel called the Hotel Bonvecchiati as opposed to Hotel PALACE Bonvecchiati. Although we only passed it once we gather it is more traditional in style. If you're looking for a contemporary 'boutique' type hotel stick to the Palace Bonvecchiati...we certainly will!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveandSonya
Reviews.Content: After taking a very slow train from Monte Carlo to Venice through Milan (and missing our connection to Venice) we arrived at Palace Bonvecchiati feeling exhausted. Unfortunately on checking in we discovered that our travel agent had made a mistake with our booking. Two rooms had been booked, with the hotel receiving payment for a standard room while we were under the impression that we had booked and paid for a Junior Suite. The lady at reception put us into the Junior Suite, told us not to worry, they wanted us to have a lovely holiday in Venice and they would sort it out later. Could've been a problem but it was resolved immediately. We had a wonderful time in Venice. An absolutely beautiful city. The hotel is in a fantastic location - a short stroll to San Marco Piazza in one direction and the Rialto Bridge in the other. Book a Junior Suite if you come to this hotel as it has an amazing balcony area and a lovely large room. Hotel staff are wonderful and hotel is contemporary and spotlessly clean. We would love to return to Venice and would definitely stay at this hotel again. On leaving we realised the error with booking had occurred in Australia but Christian on reception was wonderful and their only concern was that we had enjoyed their wonderful city and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: symahaider
Reviews.Content: I never usually take the time to write a review, however I fee that my recent stay warrnats the time. We stayed for 3 nights and have to say it was the best hotel Ive ever stayed in. Staff were absolutely brilliant and they made the stay really comfrtable with the room being cleaned during the day and being prepared for the night also. The spa is nice also for an hours relaxation time before going out. Cant fault the hotel in any way at all. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for accom in venice. Perfect location also with closeness to rialto and st marks square.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinfoolVA
Reviews.Content: Loved our experience at this hotel. Great service, clean & spacious accommodations, & for a very reasonable price. The breakfast in the morning was great, too. Very, very close to the big attractions like St. Mark's Square, etc. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - fab location”
Reviews.Author: echo10
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great location. Just a couple of minutes walk from both the Rialto and St Marks Square. Quiet with some rooms with canal views. Rooms were excellent, we stayed in a standard room and couldn't fault the rooms at all. bathroom lovely, clean, tidy and well serviced. We will definately return on our next trip to this beautiful city./

Reviews.Title: “Great on every level”
Reviews.Author: austravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo Bonvecchiati for one night in January 2008 as part of a world trip and it was great on every level. The room was scrupulously clean and beautifully appointed. The room rate included a free private boat trip to the island of Murano, with the option to invite friends for an additional fee, which we did. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Given the quality of this hotel and the extras, the room rate represented real value for money. The buffet breakfast was small but nice. I would not hesitate to stay here again, to experience the opulence & wonder of this magical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: MissMerryberry
Reviews.Content: After lots of research, mostly on Tripadvisor, we selected this hotel for 4 extra nights at the end of a 12 day Club ABC Tour ending in Venice. This is a sleek, yet warm hotel very conveniently located near St. Mark's square but not so close so it's nice and quiet. The layout of the room was great, the bed was soooo comfortable, the air conditioning was perfect and although it was expensive ($444 per night), it was a bargain for Venice given the amenities and the location. The concierge staff were very polite and accomodating. This was a real find. It has a sister hotel called Hotel Bonvecchiati but we did not go in there. Palace Bonvecchiati was a true gem and we would happily stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadaboutVenice
Reviews.Content: My mother, two sisters and I stayed in this hotel for the second time to celebrate my eldest sister's birthday in the most romantic city on earth. The hotel is of a modern, contemporary style but is extremely comfortable nonetheless. Just a few minutes walk from the Rialto stop it is easily reached and is perfectly placed in the heart of the city. The hotel was as immaculate on our second visit as it had been on our first and our rooms were spotlessly clean with crisp white bed linen and fresh flowers in the room. We shared adjoinging bedrooms with an interconnecting door which felt friendly and spacious. The en-suite bathrooms were first class, decorated in green and blue marble with fluffy white towels, robes and slippers, toiletries and a good hair dryer. The rooms were air conditioned and extremely quiet at night. The buffet breakfast had a good selection to please everyone with both hot and cold choices. The gym has wonderful views over the rooftops and the steam room and jacuzzi were a real treat to relax in after a long day walking. The staff were professional and welcoming and the manager greeted us personally, treating us to complementary champagne to celebrate my sister's birthday, which was a surprise greatly appreciated by us all. It was a perfect hotel in which to stay to enjoy the unbelievable beauty of Venice. I would highly recommend it to any traveller and hope to stay there again myself one day.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in an ancient city”
Reviews.Author: makMumbai
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 reasons 1) It has a gym 2)I got a great deal for a deluxe junior suite which i believe is the best room. I have always been fascinated by venice.Though this was only my 2nd visit there, it is my favourite holiday destination. The hotel has the best location 5 minutes walk from San Marco and Rialto bridge and in the heart of the shopping area. Always take a private taxi to and from the airport and pay 100 euros rather than taking the vaperatto and getting lost with your luggage.Venice is beautiful and shopping is good and so is the food ,gandola rides are a must ,cruising the grand canal from San zaccaria in front of danieli to piazale Roma (bus station) and back in line 1 vaperatto is a must.Walk arround the streets of castello and canneregio and to a lesser extent san polo to see how people in venice live.Rialto to san marco square doesnt show that.We prefered eating near rialto .Cafes near san marco were too expensive and not value for money compared to rialto As far as the hotel is concerned apart from the location the hotel had a huge room(deluxe junior suite) with a fab. bathroom,we had a view of a small canal which was beautiful with the gandolas passing by,specially at night sometimes with a professional singer performing.Breakfast was good.The hotel has a small bar but no restaurant.However lot of them nearby.it has adequate gym,small neat lobby.Staff were a bit mixed.There were a few who were polite and helpful and a few who were cold.Not that it mattered.Mark my words this hotel has the best location,better than danieli,Bauer il palazzo,westin etc and is half the price as compared to them.Not far from a 5 star.We didnt go to murano or burano this time however we used the beach at lido.Though it was quite empty being a windy monday it was a beautiful island with clean sand and blue waters of the adriatic sea.We also visited Rome and paris which i have visited many times before but venice was the best of the three.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JustMeLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day break at this fantastic hotel, definetely one of the best i have stayed in. Its location is perfect, just a few minutes walk from Piazza San Marco and Rialto. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely, extremely clean and tastefully decorated, with all the mod cons one may need (plasma tv, computer and internet, air conditioning, lots of hangers, a wide range of toiletries, bath robe and slippers...even digital weighting scales!). It was so nice that you wouldn't even mind not having a great view, as i read in other reviews (you must remember you are in Venice and most of the streets are pretty narrow, but as i said, it didn't bother us at all, the inside of the room made up for it). The gym was great too. The fact that you need to make a reservation to use the sauna and jacuzzi means that you don't have to share it with strangers, and for half an hour it's just yours (that, for me, is a bonus!) Breakfast was very good too. Nice variety and tasty food. We made our booking directly through the hotel website and found a better deal than through any other holiday site. I just wish we could have stayed a bit longer... I absolutely recommend this hotel and can only hope to be able to go back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: vidaandmelias
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you could want. This was a great experience for my wife and I on our honeymoon. When we first arrived in Venice, it took us a bit to find the hotel, but when we arrived we were immediately impressed with the feel of the hotel. The hotel is centrally located ... and even has a ready to go gondola ride right outside of the hotel. The service was excellent and the staff amazing. Our room was excellent ... a very modern look and feel. Of all the places we stayed in Italy, Palace Bonvecchiati was our favorite and hope to visit soon!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: EveGlos_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Palace Bonvecchiati and would have no reservation in recommending it.We got a good deal on the Hotel website and were very impressed with our room which was both spacious and stylish with an immaculate bathroom and walk-in wardrobe(Plenty of hangers too!) The staff were courteous and efficient and the breakfast buffet had something to suit all tastes.Throughout the hotel were beautiful displays of lillies and orchids which left a lovely lingering scent!Venice itself was wonderful.We were really lucky with the weather and it was not too busy either!We enjoyed The Secret Tour of The Doge's Palace and coffee and cakes at Florian's was not to be missed! Just 2 things! Venice is expensive-we paid 100 Euros for a 45 minute gondola ride (worth every cent though!).Also if you follow the directions given on the Hotel website for the Calle Bembe keep a sharp look out as it is easy to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SazzleHarrogate
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to got to Venice and it seemed the perfect destination to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The Hotel was in a central location and it made a convenient base from which to explore the city. The reception staff were very helpful and offered to pack up a breakfast bag as we had to leave early. The room we stayed in was spotless (if a little warm at times but then I did not go and request the heating to be turned down), huge bed and a turn down service every evening. We had a fantastic stay in Venice, made more enjoyable by a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: syd_travelers
Reviews.Content: We just spent a month in Europe for our honeymoon as this was by far the worst hotel we stayed at. First we booked months in advance, the travel agent notified all hotels it was our honeymoon. Then when we get there they stick us in one of their smallest rooms. No joke we couldn't even put our suite cases anywhere without blocking access to the bed. There was one foot of space between the end of the bed and the wall. The luggage rack couldn't even fit the medium sized case. With storing our cases in the bathroom our only option we went down to reception and politely asked for a bigger room. The lady on reception was quite rude telling us each room was exactly the same - something that was clearing wrong after seeing the fire escape plan in the room which showed the size of all other rooms on our floor. Eventually she offered us another room but said it's the same size. It was still small but there was room for the cases so we took it. Even on check out there was no pleasantries like "how was your stay?"; "Can we help with you bags?"; "Do you need a water taxi?â€�; This all said the rooms were immaculate with brand new fittings and a very modern bathroom - just a bit small. So very disappointing and I would warn you all to not just be wary of room 460, but also this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeighBelfast
Reviews.Content: Magnificent hotel, right in the heart of Venice. Rialto and San Marco both within walking distance. Rooms a little on the small side, but to be expected in Venice. The bathroom was quite big considering. The American breakfast was a huge spread of various meats, cheeses, breads etc. Would definately recommend this Hotel to younger couples and groups.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendileen
Reviews.Content: This hotel completely surpassed our expectations. For what turned out to be a very reasonable price, it was by FAR the nicest hotel of our trip, and actually one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in in any country for any price. Elegant, modern, quiet, and chic. Excellent service, and breakfast, and the room was lovely. Bathroom was modern and well -appointed, and the hotel has nice amenities like canal entrance if you want to take a water taxi (which is very expensive) and a gym which was clean, quiet and EMPTY. We lucked out and were given a room with a terrace - which in nice weather would have been an amazing extra plus. As it was, it was too chilly to sit on, but still - nice extra free space and view. Someone else said this in their review, and I'm going to second it - if we had known what our other hotels (later in the trip) were going to be like...I think we would never have left Venice and the Palace Bonnevecchiati at all. You should NOT hesitate to choose this hotel, it is truly a bargain, I would gladly have paid more for it, which is saying a lot. Additionally - though the location is very NEAR St. Mark's, it's actually good that it's not directly ON St. Mark's - that would be too 'touristy' and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service - One of the best in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: CME_UK
Reviews.Content: As seasoned travellers and hospitality professionals ourselves we chose the Palace Bonvecchiati for a short-break in Venice. It is no overstatement to say that the decor, service, location and facilities of the hotel are truly world class and a refreshing change from the traditional and mostly tired hotels in this tourist destination. From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble. To room was immaculate. The quality of the fittings and fixtures was great and a refreshing modern Italian style. Breakfast was a good mixture of cooked and continental with a good selection of fruit and juice to suit all tastes - highly recommend the hot chocoloate!! 5 stars to the team at Palace Bonvecchiati! We'll come again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: medsec
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked this hotel after reading good reviews and were not disappointed. We loved everything about it - the location is perfect - midway between Rialto and St Marks. It is very contemporary in style, everything new and spotlessly clean. The staff were very polite and welcoming and very helpful with any queries we had. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a canal view, and although you had to look down to see the canal what was nice was that each afternoon about 5pm (when we had gone back to our room to rest) the gondolier trips went past the hotel serenading their guests and it sounded lovely, no mistaking that you were in Venice. If I were being very picky I probably wouldn't bother asking for a canal view, but certainly a deluxe room. Our room was a deluxe room and it was brilliant - large, a separate dressing room, fantastic bathroom with shower over the bath and a separate shower cubicle. We booked the wellness centre one afternoon and had the private use of the jacuzzi and sauna (great after hard day's walking). Massage was also available. We felt like film stars and had this feeling right from the start of our trip when we transferred from the airport to Venice by private motor boat - expensive but worth it. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice, hot and cold food. Management left us a lovely decorated tin of biscuits in our room one day, and orchids in the bathroom the next day. On leaving the hotel the reception booked a motor boat for us and it actually picked us up at the landing right at the hotel door. We were in Venice during the film festival and there really was a feeling of celebrity about it. The hotel was quite expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “True jewel of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: PetLoverMom
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Italy in the heat of the summer--Venice was our third stop but the best. Used a Travel Agent for the last leg of our trip and she chose this facility, but we--hubby and I and teen son and daughter--can't rave enough about this 'Palace!" Booked two adjoining rooms--were supposed to be 2 SUPERIOR DOUBLES, but ours was upgraded to accomodate the adjoining smaller room for the kids. But the location--in San Marco on Calle Dei Fabbri could NOT be beat. We arrived (via the train station) by boat with a lovely "tour" of the Grand Cannal. It was wonderful to be so close to St. Marks Square, but far enough to not feel "on the beaten path." Staff courteous and responded imediately to correct our one "issue" (couldn't get the a/c fan to blow.) Breakfast was great, little bar was fun to have a night-cap in and entire hotel seemed recently "moderized." Computer hook-ups in rooms great too. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: jjaxon06
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We found the staff to be very helpful. they gave great suggestions for dinners, great directions, and were accommodating to all of our needs. Our room was super clean. It had a modern clean feel to it with a big comfortable bed. We were in the back of the hotel and had a quiet place and felt like we had the hotel to ourselves. The bathroom was beautiful and clean. Overall I would definitely stay here again (although I don't think we will be going back to Venice 3 days was about 1 too many to be there).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Modern Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: tormentedmom
Reviews.Content: We went with a group of friends and ended up staying in two rooms in Palac Bonvecchiati. Wow , doubles were spacious and fantastic decor (modern) great bathrooms.We also had a bigger rooms with an extra bed and still there was space. This is in a magnificent location between St Marco and Rialto 2min walk. Great shops nearby . Dont bank on the bar being open and if it is give it a miss as drinks are really expensive instead pop outside and go to the Reataurant A la Valigia , (turn left and 3 m on rhs)wine by the glass E2.50 bottles of prosecco E17 . Go ask for Samual or Colauzzi and they will feed you fresh fish and the best of wine at a great price ( dont be put off by the basic look of this place the crack is great) Breakfast at the Palac is very good and you can get your day off to a great start. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel on small canal in heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: msserene
Reviews.Content: We selected the Bonvecchiati because we found a great and reasonable package at a time when the dollar was very weak. Compared to the more "elegant" hotels on the Grand Canal, we got a very good deal. We ended up liking the hotel very much even though it is not "Italian elegance" like some others we saw. The location is most convenient on a small canal halfway between the Plaza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge, two of the most important landmarks in Venice. A private water taxi can drop you right at the hotel door on the small canal, or about four blocks away on the grand canal from which you can easily walk (if you know the way.) Lots of great restaurants and good shopping were right outside our door. The hotel is not of the grand old elegant Italian style. It's more New York style, maybe a little like a W. The lobby is contemporary, the bar is small and modern. Our room was a good-sized room done in the latest look of NYC or Chicago. Our bath was small but very updated. We had a window that opened out over the canal and we could watch the gondolas go by and even hear the gondoliers who sang. But we also could hear the trash and laundry boats that came by at 6:30 in the morning. Continental breakfast came with the room and was a nice, large buffet in a small dining room off the lobby. It was always crowded, but we never had to wait for a table. They made me a great latte (a double espresso with warm milk mixed together was my request). Our package offered a lot of extras, but we used very few. The most valuable was the water taxi to the airport as those are very expensive. We also used the massages, which turned out to be half an hour and just average. But included. We did not use the glass factory tour or the casino entry voucher and something else I've forgotten. But the rate was still good. The front desk personnel were great, got us reservations in wonderful restaurants, found us a terrific local guide for a private tour, drew maps for us, pointed out where to shop, and on and on. It's a fine hotel, but Venice has so many, we might try somewhere else next time---maybe on the Grand Canal for a bit more $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_Gi_doc
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean little hotel. Good location near San Marco square, which is where you want to be if it's your first time to Venice. Room is small, typical of Europe. But bathroom is modern and very clean. Nice extra service like bed turn down at night. Only disappointment was the poor recs from front desk girls for restaurants. Went with tour guide recs instead and got great meal at Fiaschetteria Toscana near the Rialto bridge. Also, got a unexpected good meal at Cafe Saraceno near Rialto bridge by the water. There, you get great view of Gondolas as they come in. Thought I would be paying for view but food was not bad and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: asitwasCumbria
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 5 night stay at this hotel. Got extremely warm welcome on our arrival by concierge "Ugo" at reception. Gave us helpful advice about how to spend our first day in Venice. Room gorgeous, very clean, felt like we were the first to use it. Beautiful bathroom - stylish and well equipped. They had thought of everything, even sticking plasters provided. Before our visit, we had wondered about upgrading, but didn't and didn't regret it. Breakfast was fine, although breakfast room quite small, so not intimate - tables close together, but we didn't mind. Great location, close to Rialto bridge and St Mark's Square. We took water taxi from airport to Rialto bridge - cost 90 euros, but only took around 25 minutes. Gondola ride (45 mins) one evening cost 100 euros, but worth it. Few tips: buy a street map before you go to help navigate to hotel. Mark on map best shops, cafes etc you find, as it's difficult to locate them again at a later date - so many little alleyways can get confusing. Weather in October very variable so go prepared. We had cloud, rain and sunshine and a major flood at high tide one day. Take lots of money - 2 chocolatey coffees + 1 cake in St Mark's Sq cost 30 euros, although much cheaper elsewhere. Visit Burano island - very quaint and colourful. We liked it better than Murano. Peggy Guggenheim modern art gallery worth a visit - made a change from all the Madonna and bambino paintings and crucifixions so prevalent everywhere else. Also note max value of travellers' cheques you can cash at a time is 250 euros. Overall amazing place. We loved it. Would definitely stay at same hotel if we were to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbdgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Bonvecchiati at the end of September and loved it. We got the standard room and they upgraded us to a room with a terrace which was fantastic. Although not much of a view, the terrace was wonderful to sit out and enjoy the beautiful weather and gave us the feel of having a larger room. The only criticism would be that the room was indeed very small. The bathroom and shower was so tight it was a bit claustrophobic but this is probably true of most European standard rooms. Breakfast was good, location perfect, good staff, clean and modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TashaLin
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect. We booked A Taste of Venice package. We had a junior suite overlooking a side canal. It was vey roomy; lovely bathroom complete with a live orchid and bidet; shutters that blocked all the noise and light for sleeping. Breakfast each morning offered everything anyone could want in an European breakfast and more. The hotel itself was beautiful, centrally located and had a very friendly and helpful staff. I had a massage every afternoon. This is my 3rd trip to Venice and we have stayed at a couple of lovely hotels including the Gritti Palace, but this will be my hotel of choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: lgaff
Reviews.Content: Palace Bonvecchiati was a great hotel. We were upgraded to a junior suite. The location is ideal right between rialto & st. marks square. We took the water bus from the train stain and it was very easy walk to the hotel (even with a lot of luggage). We did get a private transfer to the airport which was absouletly worth the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, clean hotel, ideal central location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_JT
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice. We stayed at the Palace Bonvecchiati for two nights, prior to joining a Med cruise, and it suited our needs perfectly. Interestingly (having read other recent reviews), we didn't book a "superior" room, and it was just fine. Very modern, clean white cotton sheets & duvet, comfy bed, modern, clean bathroom with large shower cubicle, and good AC - all in all, just like the website photos. The service was good, staff friendly, and breakfast (which was included) was fine (just what you'd expect from a typical European hotel - a variety of continental meats & breads, fruit, patisserie etc., but not Full English!) We arrived at the airport late at night, and following reading reviews, took the water bus to San Marco (12 Euros) instead of a water taxi (80-100 Euros) - however we regretted this after the two hour trip (it goes really slowly and makes loads of stops on the way, and you're inside so can't see much) - apparently the taxi only takes half an hour, and we would gladly have paid the extra due to our exhaustion and the fact it was midnight. We also hadn't reckoned on trudging the luggage up and down the steps of the various bridges to get to the hotel! We did take a water taxi from the hotel to the cruise terminal, which was fantastic, as we sailed right down the Grand Canal for 20-30 mins, standing up at the back of our water taxi and feeling like royalty as we sailed under the Rialto Bridge in the sunshine - our photos from this are fab! The Rialto Bridge is nearer to the hotel than San Marco, and there are NO STEPS if you have luggage! Palace Bonvecchiati is in an ideal location, and within walking distance of everything in the tourist areas - we felt two days was ideal to see everything there, and go up and down all the various side streets to take in the authentic bits on the outskirts.

Reviews.Title: “Overpirced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: denverbaby
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that I am not sure who to blame for the experience we had at this hotel. We booked the room through Orbitz and then I emailed the hotel to request a nice room as it was our honeymoon. We arrived to find that we were booked in a handicapped room. There was nowhere to store our luggage - the room was laid out poorly and was narrow and uncomfortable. The bathroom was the worst - there was water everywhere after we took a shower. I have no idea what a normal room looks like at this hotel so you might want to read my review with caution. The location is wonderful. There was a man at the front desk who was very helpful and friendly. The woman behind the desk wasn't very nice. We stayed at 3 other hotels in Italy and this was the most expensive and the WORST!

Reviews.Title: “Professional and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: artyliz
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean with expertly designed contemporary decor, we booked this on the strength of other positive tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The room was well-appointed with an excellent bed and, considering the central location, very quiet. Breakfast was included for us and worthwhile with a variety of cooked and cold meats plus ample fruit, cereal, bread and pastries. One minor gripe is the charge for using the internet - â‚¬8 an hour (min). Radisson SAS Hotels include this as standard and are to be commended for it. The location is perfect for the major attractions of Venice with St Marks Square less than 5 minutes' walk away along with the designer shops (make sure your credit card can stand the strain). La Fenice, the Opera House, is also within easy reach. Be warned, the maze of streets and alleys will provide a stern test of your map reading abilities. The staff are efficient, though reserved and cool. Overall, this is a professionally run Hotel and a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: edmontontraveller11
Reviews.Content: We took a ferry to St. Mark's square from the train station and walked to the hotel. It was not far from St. Mark's and we got to explore the city a little on the way! We didn't try the restaurant but the breakfast was large with lots of choice. The room was clean and large in comparison to some of our European hotel rooms. Wonderful linens on the beds. The front desk staff spoke English well and were able to direct us for dinner close to the hotel. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: babe1babe219
Reviews.Content: Although a little difficult to find at first, once you get to the hotel you won't be dissappointed. The reception was great and we were made to feel very welcome right from the start. It is a fab place to explore Venice (about 5-10 mins from both St Marks Sq and Rialto Bridge). Room (superior) was lovely and big, and we were provided with bath robes and slippers which was a nice added touch. Air con was definitely enjoyed as it was so hot outside. Hotel did have a gym and jacuzzi (although we did not have time to use it!) Breakfast was good (continental breakfast) with a good choice of sweet breads, cheese, ham and juices. There was also cooked food such as sausage and bacon. Great way to start a days wandering. (Watch out for the mint juice...we found it a bit odd.) Staff were very friendly, and everywhere was kept nice and clean. A very modern hotel, with good decor. As we were on quite a tight budget, we found the alliguna the best way to get to the island from the airport. Its also a nice way to see some of the other surrounding islands. Water taxis may get there faster, but are way more expensive. There are loads of water bus stops around venice, and if youre into glass shopping Murano is a good choice (just be mindful that there seems to be a significant lack of toilets on Murano island!) There were a few good restaurants surrounding the hotel, some more expensive than others. Pizzaria's are common place and usually you can get a huge slice of take-away pizza for only a few euros...great if you don't want a sit down meal. We found a great supermarket up one of the streets from realto, where water/etc is much cheaper than the water front (28cents compared to 2euros for a 2litre bottle!) However, this was found on one of our wanderings, so we cannot remember where it is exactly. Overall, our experience of Venice and this hotel was a positive one, and we would definitely go back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: magpie57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 17th to 21st July 2007 and cannot fault this hotel. The location was perfect right between St Marks' and the Rialto Bridge and was within easy walking distance of the all the main attractions. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean and the air conditioning was fantastic, we stayed there during the recent heat wave so it was particularly appreciated after a hard days sightseeing. Breakfast was very good and had something for everyone and set you up nicely for the rest of the day. Walking is the best way to get around in Venice, lots of little back streets to explore. We only used the vaporetto twice the whole time we were there, once when we arrived and once to go round the grand canal. If you have any money left after your stay, blow it on a water taxi back to the airport from the hotel (itâ€™s expensive, over â‚¬100 ) but worth it. We left at 5:15am and it was magical, all misty and atmospheric, it was the perfect end to a brilliant holiday. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for a Magical Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kitty_Forbes2B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. We arrived at Venice airport and took the local transport. Details from the hotel were exact and after only 45 minutes we were checking in to this wonderful hotel. The reception staff were very helpful and although we were early we were whisked away to our room. It was spacious and very clean. The bathroom looked brand new and was also roomy. The breakfast was delicious with something for everyone. The location was perfect and only a few minutes walk to both the square and Rialto Bridge. This trip was made extra special as my partner proposed..........so unexpected and so romantic. We celebrated by going to Harry's bar for a Bellini. You have to go.....just to feel the buzz and atmosphere.I hope to return to this hotel on our special wedding anniversaries.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DavidMooney
Reviews.Content: This is a really good modern hotel in the centre of Venice. Modern hotels are few and far between in Venice but this one fits the bill. Large spacious room with excellent air con system, which was needed. The hotel is in a prime location for all the major attractions and there are also quite a few good eating places both cheap and also upmarket with a price tag to reflect this. Shoppers cannot go wrong here,there are loads of shops right on the door step. The price to stay is a bit steep but overall worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a winner”
Reviews.Author: fourpines
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Venice, so our memories of the Palace Bonvecciati is still very fresh. The term "Boutique Hotel" has become overused lately, but not in the case of this hotel. Our deluxe room was spacious--even by American standards--the large bathroom had every amenity imaginable, the room was cleaned twice daily, the staff excelled (particularly Hugo at the reception desk), and the breakfast was ample, varied, and delicious. We have stayed at far more expensive hotels (example: Regina and Europa in Venice) which we have certainly enjoyed, but at none did we feel that we received better service and accommodations at a far more reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Liz75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2007. We absolutely loved this hotel. This hotel is located five minutes from San Marcos and conveniently located next to most attractions and shopping areas. It is an ideal location for tourists. The Vaporetto and Water Taxis are all close by. The hotel itself was luxurious and comfortable. The entrance, front, and lobby were all very new, clean, comfortable and elegant. At least from the outside, it looked much fancier that some of the more expensive hotels we knew off. The rooms were large by European standards. The room was comfortable and had nice, neutral decor. We had a flat panel TV and actually had a room for a desk in our room (this was unheard of in any other place we stayed). Our view was nothing special - but then we weren't looking out the window much. The bathroom was large and luxurious (it had a double sink and double shower). Breakfast was nice. Good food and good coffee. The only problem was that it was served in a small room. So you did feel a bit crowded during breakfast. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. When we arrived, we were walking around a bit lost around San Marco. However, we called the hotel, and they stayed with us on the phone to walk us to their location. Also, we asked them the best way to see Murano and they arranged for a private Water Taxi to take us to Murano for free and get a private tour of the glass factory. (The only issue with that was that we were then shown the most beautiful glass around which isn't usually available to 'ordinary' customers and kind felt like we had to buy it. I loved what I got but it was expensive). All in all, I would love to come stay here again! The whole experience was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazdagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February and had a fantastic time. The location was great - just a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square. Hotel was immaculate, staff were friendly and helpful and room was very comfortable. We would definitely recommend the hotel and I know we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel minus one tiny infarction”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerLINY
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in may 2007 for 3 nights. when we first arrived at the hotel, via water taxi, the staff was very helpful and courteous; they even gave us a free upgrade and a welcome gift of a box of venetian biscotti. the room was just gigantic and with a canal view. it was so clean and ultra modern that it took our breath away. the hotel itself is the modern boutique type. the location is prime; just a couple of minutes walk from piazza di san marco (and you won't get lost because it's a straight shot to the piazza). the breakfast was good for european standards. the only thing that annoyed us somewhat was that they don't provide irons (which i guess is typical for europe) and you can't even use your own. when they found out that we had an iron, they locked us out of our room so they could tell us not to use our iron. very childish if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique bliss”
Reviews.Author: holslove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Bonvecchiati for three nights at the start of our honeymoon. We booked a special package of junior suite, free water taxi, bottle of bubbly, complimentary newspaper, free sauna, gym use etc... And we were not disappointed. For a start, this is the only boutique hotel we could find in the San Marco district. Secondly, it is conveniently located for St Mark's Square, Rialto, all the main attractions. All in all, a perfect spot - especially for your first stay in venice, as it was ours. The hotel staff were absolutely charming and accommodating. Our suite was huge, very swish with flat screen tv and all mod cons. It also had a view of a small side canal. The gymnasium/spa room were well equipped. There was a steam room, sauna, jacuzzi as well as all the equipment you need for a (tiny) spot of holiday exercising. Would we go back? Absolutely. However, I'm not sure we'd pay the premium we did for the junior suite next time. For honeymooners, though, the suite package is a must!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: louisejlk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May. Excellent location, very friendly and helpful reception staff. My room was a little small but my friends was much larger. Both were exceptionally clean and well equipped. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: P&SSmith
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews on Venice hotels before we settled on the Palace Bonvecchiati. We were really pleased with our choice when we arrived. The staff were extremely helpful and polite - we have sent them an email a couple of days before arriving to advise them of our late arrival - they were very prompt at replying and reassured us that a late arrival was not a problem. The check in was quick and we were allocated room 356. It was not a really large room but I think this is to be expected in most European hotels. The room had its own private balcony and although you could not sit outside, it was nice to be able to throw back the shutters and step out into the fresh air if you wanted to. We thought the bedroom and bathroom was extremely clean and well kept. They also have an evening turn down service which is nice. We felt that the hotel made our stay all the more pleasurable in Venice. The hotel is less than a 5 min walk from St Mark's Square and also about a 10 min from the Rialto bridge. You could also easily walk to the Accademia (less that 15 mins). The breakfast each morning was plentiful and the staff extremely pleasant and accomodating. would definitely stay here again - there is not a restaurant attached to the hotel but there are many restaurants nearby so this is not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good find indeed”
Reviews.Author: tripawayagain
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through expedia and called hotel ahead to double check booking (experienced problems through expedia in past) - Palace B were very helpful. Upon arrival in St Marks Sq I had no idea where to go as the roads and pathways are an absolute maze and Venice address system confuses even their own postmen. Anyway, asked at a local info office in St Marks Sq and they pointed me in the right direction - 3 mins walk from the square. Very convenient location. Upon check-in the staff were extremely friendly sending a bell boy up to room with us to show us how everything functions etc. Good size room with bedroom 'partitioned' off from rest of room. Bathroom very nice with double shower. Rooms are very modern, clean lines, neutral tones etc. Breakfast is usual european buffet that does the job but the coffee... THE BEST I'VE HAD. EVER. I would go back to this hotel just for the coffee. Seriously. The bar is small but adequate and drinks aren't the usual 3x price which makes it a good place for a few before heading out. Speaking of going out, the hotel is very conveniently located but do get a good map. We must have walked round in circles so many times and I'm usually ok with bearings. You'll save a lot of time and energy. Having popped our head into nearby hotels I can honestly say Palace B' is of a very good standard. Some hotels were either very out of the way, or very dull and aged. The hotels on the front, even the good ones, were looking tired and the amount of foot traffic going by must surely create a lot of noise. Palace Bonvecchiati is more than a safe bet. It's a lovely hotel in a great location that offers great service and fantastic coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: stedders76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location right where you need to be. We stayed for 2 nights in March. My husband and I treated our mums who also loved their twin room as much as we loved ours. The bathrooms in particular were very spacious. The hotel was clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at this hotel booked through AAA using the Travel Bound Agency. They have great hotel rates. We paid 197.50 US each night. New modern hotel. We booked 3 rooms for a party of 6. Two rooms were very spacious and clean. Third room was a little small but still very nice. Enjoyed an American breakfast each morning. Staff was friendly and service was excellent. We felt very pampered. Nice location for San Marco and Rialto areas. One reason I picked this hotel was because I thought that our private water taxi could drop us off at the hotel door. Unfortunately, the water was too high and boats were unable to go under the bridges. We were dropped off at Rialto Bridge. It's a 5 minute easy walk to the hotel from the Bridge. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boston75
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this modern hotel. We especially liked the modern decor, and up-to-date room. We checked in and had immediately had an issue because of some loud construcion to the building next door. We were able to switch rooms, which was really nice as we realized the construction was not the fault of the hotel. Our original room we had booked a "canal view". I have to say the canal view was disappointing and not worth the extra money. The window was tiny and high up on the wall. I am somewhat short and could barely see out. This was on the 4th floor. Because they had no canal views left for us to move to, we moved to the 2nd floor to a junior suite. This room was much bigger and nicer and we didn't miss the view. While the first room was a decent normal size, the junior suite washuge & great to spread out in. And, the management was nice enough to send us a bottle of champagne. The location is great for sight-seeing. It is pretty much in the very middle of Venice, very near St Mark's Square. It would be convienant to take a private water taxi here, as they have a landing dock. We weren't able to do so on arrival, though, as the tide was to high. This was a little bit of a pain because we had drag our luggage through the streets of Venice. A hotel on the Grand Canal may have been easier to get to in our case. The breakfast was great, with a lot of choices. The staff was nice and friendly and everyone spoke great English.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, very modern, private water taxi door”
Reviews.Author: tmynatt
Reviews.Content: Booked this place online with Octopus Travel for $700 (not euro) for 4 nights. Our room was very nice even though there was not much of a view. Tried emailing the hotel directly as well as their own online booking and their price was always more than 200Euro per night. Way to go Octopus Travel. The location cannot be beat. Turn right from the front door, and you will end up in San Marco. Turn left and you will end up at Rialto. Turn left out the front door, and the restaurant your immediate right (Viago ???) is EXCELLENT with very good prices and high quality food. It was always packed with locals. Anyway, our room at the hotel was quite spacious even though I'm sure it was the bottom of the line room. The beds were a little hard, but everything was clean as a whistle. Our bathroom only had a shower, but it was still bigger than our bathroom at home...very nice. The doors to the rooms are all controlled by credit card sized keys that you hold in front of the card reader at the door which buzzes the door open for you. The internet connection is from your room via the television and their own keyboard (unless you have your own laptop). Their equipment is a joke. When looking at the internet on the TV I was reminded of my old Commodore 64 (remember those?) and the keyboard was horrible ...like the old IBM PC Jr keyboard. The breakfast room was a good size and there was never a wait. The food was plentiful and good with all of the typical cereals, fruits, pastries as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. I highly recommend this hotel for it's location and especially if you can get a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ladynred9
Reviews.Content: We were already looking forward to staying at the hotel based on the website. But when we got there they not only upgraded us due to our honeymoon they sent up champagne to celebrate. We were thoroughly pleased with the room and the service. They arranged everything for us from dinner reservation to the water taxi to the airport. The hotel was right in between the rialto bridge and st mark's square. We will definitely come back to this hotel and will recommend to anyone visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel in a wonderful position”
Reviews.Author: PatsyDronfield
Reviews.Content: Having checked tripadvisor for Venice hotels and deciding that classical chic wasnt for us we found this very modern hotel. After an eventful water bus ride (taking well over an hour) and subsequently getting lost in the dark we arrived at this beautiful hotel, The room was very clean and if any one could find fault I dont know what that could possibly be, there is everything anyone could possibly need. Having had a reasonable breakfast the following morning we set off for the Rialto Bridge and market which was easy to find, turn left out of the hotel and keep going. If you turn right go over the first bridge and keep going you will find yourself in St Marks Square. This was a thoroughly enjoyable break let down only by the weather. If you can afford a water taxi then it is the best way of getting to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: personwales
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we've stayed in in a European city. The location was fantastic and the directions given by other reviewers on how to get there from the airport were spot on - I recommend taking them with you. The hotel is modern and the staff were really helpful - anticipating requests such as offering to keep our luggage when we checked out. We had a room at the back which was really quiet - a real plus in the centre of a big city. The only down side in the room was that the curtains were a bit thin and it wasn't very dark at night. We got used to it but some blinds would have really made the room perfect. Breakfasts were really nice although the breakfast area is a little cramped if you happen to hit "rush hour" but the staff were really helpful and there wasn't anyone trying to rush you on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireLadyHarden
Reviews.Content: We have just been at this Hotel in Venice for 4 nights We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful check -in manager who immeditely gave us a map of the area. This is a must as you could very easily get lost and even with the map we had difficulty at times Our room was spotlessly clean and very pleasant. Towels were changed twice a day and the bedding every day which although I find rather excessive it was very nice to have such crisp bedding to rest our very weary bodies on each night. There is everything you need in the room even down to plasters for sore feet. All the staff in the Hotel were vey friendly and nothing seemed too much trouble. One word of warning though we left our windows open and were badly bitten by mosquitos! The breakfast was adequate although the coffee very disappointing. The freshly squeezed orange juice was excellent and the scrambled egg better than average The Hotel is ideally situated for visiting all the main sites but I would definitely recommend comfortable shoes as it can be very tiring. I would definitely stay at this Hotel if I went again

Reviews.Title: “Two Sting - be warned”
Reviews.Author: Tyke-wanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on the 18th to 22nd February at the end of Carnival. Had room 456 on the top floor with views over the canal over the roof tops to St Marks square. Good sized room clean and bright. Unfortunately at 6:00 in the morning a tradesman nearby starts his motorboat for 15 minutes before setting of to work. Okey its his city but a bit annoying. Breakfast included and very acceptable. Very convenient location. We obtained a list of restaurants from this site and first night managed just to get into Hesteria Al Vecio Bragosso which was an excellent meal. Monday wanted to go to Ristoante Rivieria and asked reception to book a table unfortunately there was no answer nor to another suggestion and the receptionist recommended Trattoria Do Forni ... had seen poor reports on this site but was assurred it was superb. What an experience. Half the Italian catering industry work at the place, cheapest wine was 26 Euro I didn't look beyond 1260 Euro . Food was typical of a restaurant 30 years ago. Best course was Souffle with chocolate sauce which has 45 minutes wait to be cooked which enables you to watch the other diners. We had silican enhanced wife in low cut dress being given exceptionally attentive service by waiters on nearby table and younger Yoko Ono who ordered one of the more expensive wines that the head hauncho poured with great florish. Total cost for our meal 160 Euro - Ouch. Another day arranged a guided tour via reception, excellent guide but charged 100 Euro per hour cash by the hotel - since found web site of guide - costs only 60 Euro per hour - Ouch. Had excellent weather and loved Venice but not returning back to this hotel nor to Trattoria do Forni.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location, and nice clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palace Bonvecchiati for 3 nights during Valentines week while the Carnival was on. The hotel is located in a very central location just a few minutes walk to Rialto bridge and St. Marks square. We arrived late on a Monday night and got the Waterbus or Vaporetto to St. Marks square â‚¬12 each (you buy tickets in arrivals hall), it takes about an hour, and then we had to walk to hotel, unfortunately it was raining so we got soaked, you can't hail a taxi in Venice, there are none. If you have a good map you should find it easy enough, about 10/15 mins walk from water bus to hotel. The room was a junior suite and was small but very clean and modern, can't fault it really. We also had a lovely balcony looking down onto the street and you could see Campanile from it too. Breakfast is simple enough, mainly bread, cheese, pastries, scrambled egg and juices and yoghurt, which was all fine. I can't really fault the hotel. Venice is just such a romatic and mystical place well worth a visit. 4 days is plenty to see all the main sights and you can walk everywhere, just make sure you have good walking shoes and a rain mack and a very good street map because it is sooooo easy to get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: NowinFrance
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected from a "luxury" property! Do not expect ANYTHING in the way of peronalized or additional service from the staff. There is nothing unique, splendid or extraordinary about the property itself or the guest relations. Typically we do not write reviews of hotel properties, but were so dissapointed with PB that we would not stay here again, and would dissuade others from choosing this property. Save your euros, book a less "luxurious" property, and use them to explore and shop Venice and Murano. Our room was small with no view of Venice whatsoever, only a crumbling courtyard of the hotel. The breakfast buffet was marginal at best. Staff was passively agreeable to answering questions about Venise and surrounding happenings/events. Most ammenities (spa, Internet, movies) were an additional charge above the room. The location is excellent, but many properties in Venice offer easy walks to most interesting Venezian areas. We'll try another property next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cfc
