Reviews.Content: Great hotel, first class service.Friendly staff that nothing is too much trouble for. Modern, clean and central.Very easy to find when wandering around all day. Would stay at this hotel every time.Wonderful city and people

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Skipster06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Very modern, only 5 minutes walk from the water bus stop & easy to find. The room was lovely and spotlessly clean. You couldn't hear any other guests talking in their rooms. Portering service, key card entry to the door, digital safe in the room, bath, shower and heated towel rail. Good quality reception for the tv and beds turned down every night and very comfortable (even for a 6 foot person). The full breakfast had everything from pancetta, scrambled eggs, fresh coffee and tea, juices, pastries, breads, yoghurt and tinned and fresh fruit and polite waiters. Reception staff were friendly enough and spoke good English. You could catch a gondola from the side door of the hotel (80 euros) and less than 3 minutes walk to St Marc's Square. Close to all shopping and great restaurants and deli's and pubs/bars. I would definitely stay here again next time. Great price for great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpugliese
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent New Year's Eve in Venice this year and stayed at Palace Bonvecchiati from Dec. 28, 2006 - Jan 2, 2007. It was fantastic! I had reviewed many hotels when booking on Expedia, and chose this hotel mainly due to the great reviews on Trip Advisor. I would highly recommend that anyone looking at this hotel choose to stay here. I cannot imagine you will find anything comparable in this price range. I would stay here again if I were to return to Venice. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern. The hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathroom is modern and fairly large. The hotel is located halfway between San Marco Square and the Rialto Bridge. This is a great base location for exploring all of Venice. Do eat at the wonderful Le Bistrot de Venise which is located right across the way from the hotel's main entrance. Great service, fabulous authentic Venetian fare and a wonderful wine list filled with many well known wines as well as local finds you cannot get in the states. Another great restaurant is located in the hotel's sister property Hotel Bonvecchiati. Getting to the hotel via public transportation is easy enough. From the airport we took a bus to Plaza Roma and then took a water bus to the Rialto stop. The hotel will provide you directions that point you down a narrow alley once you exit the boat. It may not seem as though you're going the right way, but you are. Just keep going straight and you'll come upon the hotel on your right after about 400 meters. We had an early flight the day we left so we had the hotel call us a private water taxi. It's about a 30 minute trip and costs 100 euros. The walk from the taxi stop to the terminal is about 5 minutes, so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous...Stylish AND friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful weekend break in Venice having stayed in the lovely Palace Bonvecchiati. We had booked it having read some of the rave reviews on this site, and were definitely not disappointed! The decor is very stylish and trendy and it has a water door for ease of arrival from the airport. (E90 for the water taxi trip). The staff were some of the friendliest, helpful and warmest I have ever met outside of the Far East. Our bedroom was a superior double and it was immaculately presented, with flat screen tv, mini bar, robes and slippers, padded hangers and a very stylish padded leather headboard. Everything was gleamingly clean, and the selection of vanity kit items was excellent. The only small drawback was the lack of room service (apart from breakfast which you could have delivered at a supplement) as I like the reassurance of being able to order a sandwich in the middle of the night if the munchies strike! However, it would never prevent me from staying here again. Location is amazingly convenient...just minutes from Rialto and St. Marks Square, amidst lots of wonderful shops and myriad winding streets. This hotel is an absolute gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wareagle77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very hip and trendy as other have noted. The breakfast is above average with a buffett each morning. The only complaint I have is there was a slight smell that permeates the hotel's ventilation system. It's obviously from the waters outside, and you can definitely look beyond that, but that is what prevents me from giving it 5 stars. Also, the "water garbage taxi" also loads up each day outside at the canal. All in all, no major worries and it is definitely a bargain compared to other fine hotels in Venezia. PS- Stay away from the sardines from the local restaurants. I still picture those things in my nightmares. haha

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Wonderful Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: triathlongirl1
Reviews.Content: My family, including our two teenage girls, spent four nights at the Palace Bonvecchiati after Christmas. Our adjoining rooms were spacious, and the bathrooms were lovely. The location is great - midway between St. Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. We arrived via private water taxi from the airport, directly to the hotel's water door. We found the staff to be very helpful, the breakfast excellent - especially the coffee! Plenty of great little restaurants in the neighborhood, and walking distance to lots of shopping. I would recommend getting a Venice Card which covers some museums and all public water taxis. Easy walk to Rialto to catch water taxi to the train station. Wonderful hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Vs Old”
Reviews.Author: xxVernxx
Reviews.Content: Brilliant. The only hotel I know in venice that is Modern Boutique. Very unusaul to be able to stay in this type of hotel right in the center of historical Venice. If you've stayed in the old historical palace type hotels before, certainly they are lovely, but if you want a change then this is the hotel for you. A really different way to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What every hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: emjaykay
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this wonderful hotel for a long weekend break. Try as one might it would be difficult if not impossible to find a fault with this delightful establishment. Location is excellent being an easy and short walk to both Rialto Bridge in one direction and St. Mark's Square in the other. The hotel has friendly and helpful staff who all quite evidently enjoy working in their environment - a somewhat rare observation to be able to make. The hotel has disarmingly modern but charming decor and facilities contrasting with the antiquity of the surrounding buildings. I don't believe that I have ever stayed in any hotel with these high standards at the very keen tariff charged - the hotel represents truly incomparable value for money. It is impossible to contemplate staying anywhere else in Venice. The place is quite simply faultless. I loved it and can commend it to the most discriminating of visitors to one of the words most remarkable cities. Do not miss either of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TD25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop for our honeymoon. The hotel far exceeded my expectations! Located just minutes away from St Marks Square, this hotel is clean, modern and centrally located. We had a great stay, the staff are friendly (as friendly as you can expect in Italy) helpful and very private. We also got delivered a bottle of champagne! If you're after a clean and modern hotel in the heart of Venice, this place is it.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: FionaMcK
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from four nights in this hotel. It is very hard to find anything negative to say about this beautiful, modern and colourful hotel. It was modestly priced too. Our room on the second floor was a delux double with lovely decor, dressing room and bathroom with a touch of luxury. The staff were always extremely helpful and breakfast was a surprising feast of both hot and cold dishes, in a great breakfast room with one wall covered in stunning coloured glass. Some tips for staying in Venice, get a detailed map, its very easy to get lost!! The water bus from the airport cost 12E each and took about an hour to reach San Marco Square, a great way to approach the city by way of a few other islands. For 25E each we purchased a 3 day pass for travel on the vaparetto (water buses) which we were able to use day and night and for any distance. The only problem we had were mosquito bites!! It never occured to us to protect ourselves but we must have brought them into our hotel room after our evening trips on the canal. Other than that our trip was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rattler7
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 4 day break staying as this beautiful Hotel right in the heart of Venice. I booked a 'Standard Room' through Expedia but was still impressed with the quality of the room. Not the largest in the world, but perfectly adequate with a lovely Black Marble 'Bath'room (No Bath, but Great twin head Power Shower, Toilet, Wash Basin and Bidet). It had a huge firm but comfy bed, with leather headboard a 26 inch LCD TV and keyboard and mouse should you want to access the High Speed internet via the TV (additional Charge). The room was equipped with Air Conditioning, but this is turned off during the winter, so you might need to turn your room heating off if it is too hot (we did). The whole hotel was stylishly decorated in modern materials such as Marble, Glass, Wood and Leather - Not great if youâ€™re looking for the traditional Venetian style, but for me much better than the frills and fuss! Breakfast was great - I have seen some bad reviews of Breakfast, but with no disrespect they seem to be from Americans who are used to lots of choice - For us humble Brits it seems quite a feast! They offer you Tea and/or Coffee, have 4 different fresh juices and still and Sparkling Water. Hot food consisted of Scrambled Egg, Bacon - Italian style wafer thin of course - different to you usual slice of Back Bacon, but actually really nice and pieces of nice and meaty Italian Sausage. Apart from that there were cold meats and cheese, croissants, pain au chocolate and 5-6 different cakes/pastries. Also, cereals, fruit (whole and segments) figs and Italian Sweet Biscuits. Location-wise you couldn't really want much more you're only a 3-5 minute walk from either Rialto Bridge or St Marks Square, though nothing is very far in Venice and once you get your Vaperreto pass (water buses) it doesn't take too long to get anywhere. We used both the Gym and Spa in the, the later requiring to be booked in half hour slots, but we got booked in at Reception without any trouble. One point of caution is that the Sauna and Steam room are not left turned on and you may find they are not on when you get there - Not great when you only have a half hour slot. We ended up going in the Jacuzzi first so the others had time to heat up. Not unusually for this class of Hotel, there are no Tea or Coffee Making facilities in the room, but there are plenty of places a short walk away where you can easliy find a cup. The rooms are cleaned/prepared twice daily and slippers, dressing gowns and plenty of towels are provided, along with or the usual batroom amenities such as soaps, gels, lotions etc. And they do leave some lovely Venition Chocolates in the romo when you first get there! Overall I was very impressed with the hotel, especially considering the deal I got meant it only cost about Â£80 ($150) a night. A great bargain for a Hotel of this quality in this expensive city! I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A dream stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: MadforItaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel Palace Bonvecchiati is luxurious and modern it ticks all the boxes and more. The hotel is really central to San Marco and Rialto, just a few minutes walk to each. The rooms are very nice and big. Breakfast is great, be aware drinks in the bar are pricey. It is really straight forward to get get from the airport to the hotel. Just buy a ticket from arrivals for the bus (stand 1 bus 5 it takes about 20 mins) right outside the main doors.Then once at Piazzale Roma buy your water bus ticket to Rialto,( don't worry all stops are well signed) get off at Rialto then turn right out of the stop, cross over the first steps then immediately turn left down the first alley way, carry on along here for 2 - 3 minutes until reaching the hotel on the right. It's really easy to get around Venice on foot or if you buy an all day water bus ticket you can travel all over the Veneto or simply up and down the Grand Canal. Don't miss the trip up the Campinale it's a must see!! The hotel offers a free trip to Murano to the glass factory....if you like glassware, great, just beware the plan is for you to buy!! Eating out is a mine field, don't be afraid to walk around out of the San Marco area for some great places to eat!........Now that's enough from us, go and enjoy it's a fantasic place to explore!!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: US_Trip
Reviews.Content: Quite a deluxe hotel. We had a room overlooking a very active canal and St. Mark's Bell tower. It was worth the extra money for the ambience and atmosphere. The room was extremely clean, large and great accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel but had a problem when we checked out”
Reviews.Author: TillySue
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at the hotel. We were pleased to be upgraded to a JR suite. We had booked one night on a website and the second night by telephone..They NEVER told us when we checked in that there would be a $100 difference in the price. The manager handeled us in a rude, degrading fashion. He made us feel like we had done something wrong. They should have made us aware of our price increase when we checked in rather than at the last minute...our biggest complaing was the rudeness of the manager...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leong's
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel was a challenge for us but here's the secret. Take the water bus and get off on Rialto Exit. If you don't mind walking and lifting some suitcases over a few stairs you can walk to the hotel. Just go right when you get off the water bus and go in between the second street (near pink building) and begin walking until you see the hotel on your right. You can also pay to take Gondola or water taxi but it's expensive (between 75-120 euro's). The hotel is very modern and located in a perfect location. The hotel is on one of the smaller canals which does not provide much of a water view but is located between San Marco square and the Rialto Bridge. The room is nice, large, comfortable, and the closet is huge. The breakfast is great and a big savings since every meal is so expensive in Venice. The hotel isn't cheap but not many hotel were in San Marco area so for the price, location, and quality of the rooms this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: kitten7374
Reviews.Content: We had a JR suite and we had a canal view, which is rare..they don't have a lot of rooms with the view. That being said it was really nice. We kept our windows open and enjoyed the gondolas passing by the window. The complimentary Champagne was nice too. The room ws very nice. We did have one housekeeping issue that was resolved VERY quickly. It would not prevent us from reccommending this hotel, or staying there again. The location is great, it is close to San Marco square, and the Rialto bridge. Lots of great shops and restaurants all around. Very professional staff, and the breakfast in the morning was fantastic! Fresh pastries, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit..and the coffee was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraftonTraveler24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September 06. The hotel is modern, clean and convenient. The staff was helpful and friendly. A nice breakfast buffet was included. The location was excellent being between the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square. Worth checking out if you are going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “So lucky we picked this one!”
Reviews.Author: JD_Pocket
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! It was our first time to Venice and I am a such a fussy English man when it comes to hotel standards! (My wife always waits to unpack until I have given her the go ahead that we are not going to move rooms/hotel!) Hotel location is perfect (St Marks Sq - 5 mins walk) and if you like eating and shopping (our favourite pastimes) then again the location is great. Hotel room we had was really nice and contemporary. Hotel staff were lovely and helpful. The only negative I can think of was the breakfast layout - too small and cramped. We finished the short break off with a private speedboat transfer directly from the hotel's door way to the airport - priceless!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sleepless_Travelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Would definitely stay here again Pros: - Fabulous location (in the middle of Rialto bridge and San Marco). 3-4 minutes walk to each, Gelato place steps away and great lunch choices (deli's and not restaurants) just a few steps away) - Great staff. Very polite. Very helpful and accomodating (upgraded us and gave us a free bottle of champagne since we were celebrating an event) - Great rooms (not big) but updated and contemporary in design - Good buffet breakfast for European standards - Free water taxi to Murano (but have to deal with sales-pitch by glass factory sales rep -- really not a bad trade off) Cons - Really cannot come up with any -- size of room perhaps but rooms are generally small in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhx
Reviews.Content: We just finished a two night stay in Venice as part of a 9 day tour of Italy. Of all the four star hotels we stayed this one stood out as having the best service. Two good examples. It was rainy during our stay in Venice. We decided to take a mid-day break in our hotel room in the middle of day when it was raining hard. When we returned to the hotel after venturing out again, the bed was made again, the second time of the day, with the addition of floor mat for our shoes. The second example: it was flooded in San Marco Square. A lot of tourist had to take out their shoes to tread over a foot of water. Palace Bonecchiati provided us with the water proof boots that we desperately needed. Overall, it was a very nice stay with very modern docor, all marble bathroom which was made spotless everyday. It has a private dock for the water taxi to park just next to the hotel. It is only five minute walk to either Rialto Bridge or San Marco Square. Be sure to check out the two wonderful restaurants acrosss the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DConlon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early September as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is absolutely fantastic. I cannot recommend it enough. The hotel is a beautiful modern hotel which deserves 5 stars in my opinion. We had a superior room which was huge. The bathroom was gorgeous and very modern. The staff gave us a bottle of champagne on arrival. They turned down the beds every night too. The staff were very helpful and professional. The breakfast was fabulous, with a huge choice which is unusual for continental hotels. The hotel is situated in a great location, 5 mins walk from the Rialto and about the same from San Marco. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice, and I hope to return again many times.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: VeronieM
Reviews.Content: My family spent two weeks in Italy and we began in Venice. This hotel was fantastic. We had a view overlooking the canal and celebrated with Champagne (complitmentary) and pastries (pasta) that we purchased prior to checking into the property. The service is first class, the rooms are clean and modern and I would encourage any one to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler06
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find that Palace Bonvecchiati was a classy modern hotel in the heart of the old city of Venice. Based on the modest ranking on tripadvisor.com I expected a basic and average hotel. On the contrary, our room was huge and fabulous with gorgeous hardwood floors, a terrace, flat screen television, internet access, and a spacious bathroom. I loved the hotel so much I wanted to extend my stay. The hotel is in a great location just minutes from San Marco square and the water bus. The hotel does have a few quirks, for example YOU ONLY GET 1 room key, even if there are 2 people. In European hotels you have to leave the room key in the light switch to turn on the electricity in the room. There were times that I forgot the key in the light switch and neither myself nor my friends had another key to get back into the room so we had to call housekeeping to let us in. The other quirk is that the room DOES NOT HAVE an iron and you CANNOT borrow one from the hotel; so if you donâ€™t bring a travel iron you are out of luck. TIP: Water taxis are EXPENSIVE!!!! Best and cheapest way to get around are the water buses which run 24 hour a day. FYI: the train station is only a 15 ride from the hotel, but a water taxi cost 70 euros (roughly $93 USD). You can catch the #82 or #1 Water bus to the Rialto Bridge for only 5 Euros (roughly just under $7 USD) and the hotel is a 7 minute walk from the stop. If you have a lot of bags you donâ€™t want to carry the guys w/wheel barrels are a worthwhile investment for b/c there are no land taxis and you have a few bridges to cross in that short walk to the hotel). From the airport the water taxi is approx. 110 euros (roughly $150 USD) and the airport is approx. 1 hour from the hotel. Catch the ailaguana water bus from San Marco square for only 12 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisFred
Reviews.Content: Awesome. The heart of Venice is the last place you would expect to find such a modern, fantastic hotel. But we really lucked out with the PB. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great. While the guidebooks promote the traditional grand hotels near the grand canal and San Marco Square, to me that is the last place you would want to stay. The PB is half way between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. It is a bit of a pain to get to the hotel when dragging luggage around. But once you are settled in, the true Venice experience is waiting right outside the lobby doors. Great little cafes and hidden gem restaurants are all around. The room was a nice size (although we didn't have much a view). And it may have been the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We did not try the breakfast buffet because we preferred to find local establishments in our neighborhood. We can't recommend this hotel enough. It is quaint, romantic, comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nico1611
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for this wonderfully located hotel - about 100 meters away from San Marco, overlooking a small romantic canal. Room design is just...Italian, modern design Italian, which adds an awesome dimension to this under-rated hotel. We stayed in a gigantic junior suite that was one of the nicest rooms I ever stayed in - and I am well travelled. The staff is most friendly and helpful. This hotel is definitely a four star hotel with one issue, though: room service is about inexistent, and so is breakfast... Other than that, just go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: luli38
Reviews.Content: I just ran across our vacation pics to Italy today and it reminded me to submit this review. My husband and I visited Rome (June 12-16) and Venice (from June 16-19) for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and had a fabulous time staying at the Palace B. The hotel was absolutely wonderful. I had been to Venice as a teenager and this hotel was a welcome change from my previous accomodations! The room, while not large, was very clean and tastefully decorated. If you are not into contemporary and prefer more of traditional decor, then this may not be the place for you. A wonderful sculpture by Artist Botero is in the lobby--very cool. I particularly liked the newness of it and the friendly staff. The hotel is close to all major attractions and has some great little mom and pop bars right down the street. We happened to be in Venice during the World Cup match between the US and Italy. It was very fun to watch the game with the locals and get a feel for how exciting the sport is in Europe. The staff was great and provided some wonderful restaurant recommendations. One restaurant, Ristorante Sempione was wonderful. Moderately priced with great food and wine--try lasagna--it was great! The restaurant while not fancy, has been in Venice for a long, long time run by the same family. If you get there at the right time, you might be lucky enough to get the table at the open window/terrace, where you can watch the gondolas float by. Very romantic. I found nothing to complain about regarding this hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Make a point to take a trip to see the beach at Lido. On one of our days, we took the vaparetto and ate lunch in Lido and went to the beach. Less hectic/congested than Venice and a nice boat ride on the way over. Regarding transportation, I would recommend taking the water taxi to the hotel at the time of your arrival at the rail station, or airport. While costly, it beats wasting time trying to find your hotel. We were lucky, as we found another couple that was going to the Hotel Bonvecchiati, that is right next door to the PB and we were able to split the cost of the water taxi. On the way out of town, we were leaving very early out of the Marco Polo airport and also found another couple to split the costs of the water taxi--this was very costly as they charged us something like 90 Euros/couple for the taxi and then for the shuttle from the port to the airport. Didn't really feel that we had a choice given the time of our flight and our concerns that might not get to the aiport on time if we took public transport.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus g
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel in such a great location. Staffs were extremely professional and friendly. The hotel building was very beautiful and charming. The hotelâ€™s restaurant terrace was amazing with the great views of water ways and bridges. Pros: 1.Perfect location. Walking distance to all great places 2.Great breakfast served in superb ambiance 3.Help full staff and all speak English 4.The room we stayed was newly renovated and it was very modern and tastefully done 5.The bathroom was all marble and gorgeous 6.Rooms and hotel were spot less 7.In room safe Cons: 1.Our room although very modern lacked any charm. It was also small, but this might be the case in most hotels in Venice 2.It was difficult to control hot and cold water, since it would take a good 4 minutes for hot water to get hot. So, we asked if we could change room, but the comparable room they should us was old with all green furniture, which we didnâ€™t like, so we decided to keep our room and live with the minor plumbing issue. 3.There was no view in our room even though we asked for one. We had the view of the window of next building about 5 foot away. They told us there are only three rooms in the hotel with view and they are all booked 4.No coffeemaker in the room 5.To reach our room we had to use elevator to go to second floor, and then go down half a floor using the steps. 6.Bell boy had no dolly and carried our luggage by hand banging them into the walls most of the way. This was the case both during check-in and check-out 7. We could not adjust the AC temperature, and it was preset at 21 C. When we complained we were told the AC is central and can not be changed. Staff told us when rooms got too cold just turn the AC off! And when it got hot again turn it back on andâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in an Old City”
Reviews.Author: SKT_Devon
Reviews.Content: What an amazing find. My boyfriend and I spent 3 days in Venice last week at this lovely hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel offered everything you could possibly want. We were upgraded to a junior suite and it was wonderful! This modern, clean, air conditioned hotel was lovely to come back to after a tiring day walking and sightseeing and really made our stay in Venice special. I understand that prices vary depending on where you book it. But we had a great deal at around Â£140 per night. One thing, this hotel is classed on Tripadvisor as a 2 star hotel. However, elsewhere it's classed as a 4 star. Any 4 star hotels I've stayed in previously would compare equally to this. Really made our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: Jackson071004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our 10 day Italy vacation on a high note at the PB. What can I write that hasn't already been expressed by previous reviewers? This hotel is simply the best. I am more than adept at finding great deals/promotions so we are afforded the luxury of staying at leading hotels of the world or 5 star hotels. The PB, although rated 3 stars, rivals any luxury hotel. In summary: Location: 5 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge in one direction Piazza San Marco in the other. It also has its own water taxi stand for those who want door to door service; however, the public vaporettos are just fine considering the location. Staff: Friendly. Professional. Accomodating. Housekeeping serviced the rooms in the morning and evening. Awesome! Breakfast: Not so great. In fact, awful; however, because of where the PB is located, you have many dining options. Take advantage of them. Rooms: Magnifico. Our room overlooked a small canal. It was contemporary in size and design. A welcome change from the typical Italian style. Our bed was huge! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “In a city of so many jewels this is a real gem”
Reviews.Author: Mkeyl
Reviews.Content: We spent three days celebrating university graduation with our two children, the whole Venice experience is captivating but the quality of this hotel definitely added to our enjoyment. The location is brilliant, so close to St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge, with the rest of the city easily accessible on foot. The decor is wonderfully contemporary but fits the style of its surroundings so well. Our rooms were spacious with ultra modern quality fixtures, the public rooms are very appealing and there is both charm and sophistication throughout the hotel. We arrived just before midnight and found the night staff to be very courteous, friendly and efficient, the breakfast buffet is good although the staff didn't seem to be enjoying their jobs. The leisure centre is very well equipped and the sauna/steam bath/massage are delighful after a hard days sight seeing. We all give it top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Picky Traveler Says: Absolutely Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Palace Bonvecchiati. We are very picky travelers and found the PB to be an excellent hotel and an excellent value; it's not inexpensive, but for the quality and size of the rooms, it's a good deal. The location is terrific -- very central, yet quiet --and the rooms are large, beautifully furnished and exceptionally clean. We particularly liked the modern style; after a stay in Venice, one grows tired of brocade and glitz, and the PB is a calming, soothing counterpoint. The staff was extremely professional and helpful, the entire hotel was sparkling clean and fresh and the location great. We'll choose the PB over the Danieli or Gritti next time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Friendly staff, High Standard Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Palace Bonvecchiati in May 2006, it was heating up outside, so their excellent air con was the fastest I have seen to cool down a room. The spacious very clean rooms were modern and tasteful in design, really powerful showers, comfortable beds. All the staff from the porters, reception and housekeeping, to the bar man - who made up his own cocktails for us to try were very friendly and extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble. It was on the main path from riato to p.s. marco so you never got lost, and they have a water door, so the taxi / gondola drop off was right to the hotel. We loved this hotel, and my elderly parents did too. They have a jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna which you need to book a time for (no charge though), which were lovely after a days walking around. A gym is there too which doesn't need to be booked and has all the equipment you need. We all had a massage too, which rounded off the day's walking nicely. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Special birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My lovely husband booked a short break at this hotel last july for my 40th birthday. It was utterly wonderful. The hotel is luxurious, modern, stylish, quiet, in a great location. The staff are all lovely. It was so good, we're just booking for my birthday again this year (long may this new tradition continue). The reviews on this site were of huge help in choosing the right hotel - though I say it myself, my husband has a wife with very high standards when it comes to holidays!, and it took him much research to find the right place. It is absolutely true though, that you should get a water-taxi direct to the hotel (the hotel can arrange this) - arriving via the water-bus, then trying to find the hotel for the first time is not an experience to repeat, (especially in the heat of a july afternoon). The water-taxi trip is more expensive, but is priceless in terms of a unique way to arrive and leave this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this great hotel,over Easter.& I chose this hotel mainly due to reading tripadvisor reviews . Stayed in a VERY clean Superior Double room. We liked: 1) The walk in wardrobe with good lighting, full length morror & plenty of hangers, including some padded hangers for posh stuff ! 2) The small mini-bar fridge, good for keeping our shop bought water / chocolate etc., cold. 3) The enormous white towelling bathrobes & slippers provided to use for going to the spa 4) The complimentary chocs & bathroom goodies ( quite an array ) Also the room safe ( one of those ones where you tap in a code to use it) 5) The room was cleaned to a VERY high standard, both in the morning & also in the evening when more sweets were left & used towels replaced again. 6) The turquoise marble bathroom with loads of soft towels & a weighing scales ( NOT good when you've been eating so much delicious food ). VERY powerful shower in the bath that can soak the floor, if not careful, but there was a separate, hand-held, spray attachment that could be used to shower without drenching your hair do, ladies ! (hairdryer provided in bathroom) 7) A very good gym & HOT HOT HOT (although tiny) sauna & steam room. These are on the 4th floor & only reached by one of the two lifts (the one furthest from the Reception Desk). 8) Complimentary umbrellas provided, by the front door, in case of rain. 9) SUPERB central location of hotel. A bit disapointed with: 1) The jacuzzi which was VERY chilly & for some reason you had to 'reserve' a time to use this at the main Reception desk (no charge for this). Views across the surrounding roof tops, but the sun was streaming in the spa's windows, so even though chilly to remain in the jacuzzi too long, it was still very relaxing. 2) The modern flat screen TV was great, but couldn't get the remote controller to work properly, even though the batteries were OK ??? 3) The truly AWFUL tea at breakfast....stick with the coffee. Be aware that you must hand in your room key, to reception, every time you go out. also that the main front doors are locked after 22:00hrs. There is a bell alongside the door, for the porter to respond. Overall.......a VERY clean, modern decor hotel & great central location. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and comfortable in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and found it a great base in exploring Venice. As with previous reviews if there is a downside then it is the mediocre breakfast. Staff are helpful and eager to help when asked. Our room was large, had a comfortable bed, nice views of canal and the room and bathroom were very clean. Chocolates were delicious! The hotel has a nice gym with modern workout machines by TechnoGym, a jacuzzi, saunas etc.., although in saying that, we didn't use it as we had enough exercise walking in Venice. We found the location to be ideally placed for both the Rialto and San Marco. Do venture off away from the main areas for some beautiful views, good food and a less touristy feel. Venice is expensive and charges are often hidden such as charges for background music. Tip: when wanting a coffee or snack if you sit in San Marco square beware of sitting down where there is a live 5-piece band playing they charge for the honour of listening, they even charged our toddler full price for the music. For two hot chocolates and 1 cup of coffee + music our bill was 41 Euros=Â£28+.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic love it”
Reviews.Author: divasumner
Reviews.Content: brilliant !! hotel is very clean and staff and very helfull. our room was on a corner and had fantastic space. location is great. dont bother getting water bus when you first arrive as takes one hour and then you will have no idea how to get to hotel. spash out and get water taxi (cost was euro 100). if i had to find fault about hotel would be didnt have restaurant and breakfast not the best. but please doint let this put you off hotel is brillant. they also helped me to surprise my patner with cake in the room etc. please go here i highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Palace Bonvecchiati is a wonderful hotel - even though the elevators are a bit small and hard to manage (caution to those with large bags - there's a weight limit and the thing won't move if your an ounce over limit.) The rooms were large (compared to typical euro/boutiques) and very modern/minimalist in design. We had a canal-front room that was very romantic, especially when the gondola's are traveling by with the singers on-board. My only complaint is the hotel breakfast (served at the Hotel Bonvecchiati, across the bridge); it was mediocore (at best) and the coffee was terrible. Would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, modern decor”
Reviews.Author: M.Carter-Lee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great 5 night stay at the Palace Bonvecchiati in February. Depsite our initial difficulty in finding the hotel from the waterbus station, we soon realised that the hotel is in a prime location - minutes walk from both the rialto bridge and san marco. Our large room was decorated in a modern/minimalist style which suited out tastes completely. The shower in the bathroom was v.powerful (that's a good thing!). NB: there are no baths in the standard rooms. Breakfast was great, particualry during the week, when there are not so many tourists. On the Friday and Saturday morning it is definitely worth having breakfast before 10am when the crowds decend. We found the staff here both friendly and professional, and would have no doubts at all in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve @ Palace Bonvecchiati”
Reviews.Author: interpol81
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days at Palace Bonvecchiati in Venice for a NYE trip. I booked this hotel because of its great position (less than five minutes walk to Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge, really closed to the major attractions of the city) and because it's a lovely boutique hotel with a good value (not so pricey if you think you're in the heart of Venice) . Our room (a deluxe one) was clean, modern, pleasant and spacious, though not overlooking the canal as we requested when booking online on their website. The LCD flat tv is amazing but there's not a great selections of channels. Green marble bathroom was ok, with tub and a shower with a good pressure (even if it's easy to get a completely wet floor after a shower..) and some good products for personal care. Palace Bonvecchiati is a new and stylish hotel, but i really don't know why they still use keys and not electronic cards for their rooms, when it's clear that everything is ready for the use of electronic keys. Everytime you want to go to your room you have to ask for your room-key at the reception and it may be annoying. Unfortunately the fitness center (with turkish bath, sauna and jacuzzi) was out of service and with great disappointment we couldn't try it. The staff was helpful and nice, always ready to help us when needing. Giving umbrellas to their guests when it's raining was a good idea (that not every four star hotel have). Breakfast served on the ground floor bar was good. There's not a restaurant inside Palace Bonvecchiati, but just in front of the hotel there's a really good one called "Bistrot de Venise" with awesome tradition venetian cousine (re-visited with a modern twist) and you must try it. Definetely a good hotel, with the potential to getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Boncecchiati”
Reviews.Author: THERESA
Reviews.Content: This is Hotel is Beautiful. It's New and the Room We booked was Perfect. Big Double Bed, Leather furniture, plasma TV with internet. The bathroom was Fantastic. All orange marble. Every inch. Other than the Fixtures, Toilet and Tub it was all Marble. I wish I had it here at home. The tub was huge. I am 6 foot, and I could fit laying down. It had all the amenities and then some. A small bar in the lobby, and around the bar area Dolce and Gabbana Products for Sale, of course that's not in My budget, but cool to look at. Breakfast was included, and it was Great. Lots of choices, Meats, Cheeses, Eggs, sausage, Bacon (Raw, but at both Hotels were stayed at barely cooked the bacon) cearl, fresh fruits, yougart, homemade muffins crossiants and breads. Coffee, juices and yummy hot chocolate. Turndown Service is also provided, and they had 2 english printed papers (The Hearld and USA today) and the Lobby though small, very warm and nice. It's right in the heart of Venice. I highly recommend this Hotel while in Venice. Everyone spoke English, and the Men at the front desk were really nice, and when we asked for late check out, it was no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeYo411
Reviews.Content: What an awesome hotel. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. I recommend that you take a watertaxi from the airport directly to the hotel. Venice is a maze...you could be going in circles for hours trying to find your hotel!!The room is ultra modern and comfortable. The room was kept immaculate. The only odd thing was the bath/shower design. The wall is not long enough to stop all the water from landing on the floor. Other than that, no complaints. Enjoy your stay at this beautiful hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Palace Bonvecchiati
HotelInfo.Address: Calle dei Fabbri 4680 | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
